title: Entry Level Data Analyst (Remote)
description: SYNERGISTICIT is aware that the Job Market is Challenging because of Tech Layoffs. The Job market is flooded with hundreds and thousands of laid-off Jobseekers competing with existing Jobseekers. For entry-level Job seekers to get client interviews and jobs they need to differentiate themselves by ensuring they have exceptional skills and technologies to be noticed by clients.<br>Since 2010 we have helped Jobseekers differentiate themselves by providing clients with candidates who have the requisite skills and experience to outperform at interviews and clients. Here at SynergisticIT We just don't focus on getting you a Job we make careers. All Positions are open for all visas and US citizens We at Synergisticit understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped thousands of candidates get jobs at technology clients like Apple, Google, and Paypal, western union, Client, visa, Walmart labs, etc., to name a few. We have an excellent reputation with the clients. Currently, we are looking for Entry Level Data Analyst (Remote)<br>Who Should Apply Recent Computer Science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates looking to make their careers in IT Industry We welcome candidates with all visas and citizens to apply. We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates<br>We also offer Skill enhancement programs for candidates who are either missing skills or lacking Industry/Client experience with Projects and skills. Candidates have difficulty finding jobs or cracking interviews or want to improve their skill portfolio. If they are qualified with enough skills and have hands-on project work with clients then no need for skill enhancement.<br>Candidates can benefit from skill enhancement if they fall into the below categories.<br>Candidates who Lack Experience or are fresher with No actual Job experience with projects with clients who Have had a break in careers Lack Technical Competency or skills being demanded by clients Different visa candidates (Like OPT/H4EAD/L2EAD) who want to get employed and settle down in the USA please check the below links to see success outcomes of our candidates https://www.synergisticit.com/candidate-outcomes/<br>Watch the below videos of us participating in Industry events with the Top companies in Technology at Oracle Cloud World/Oracle Java One (Las Vegas) and at Gartner Data Analytics Summit (Florida)<br>Oracle Cloud World Event (OCW) Las Vegas 2022 | SynergisticIT - YouTube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OAFOhcGy9Z8<br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EmO7NrWHkLM https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVBU9RYZ6UI<br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yy74yvjatVg SynergisticIT at Gartner Data and Analytics Summit 2023 - YouTube<br>https://www.synergisticit.com/java-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/data-science-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/contact-us/<br>If you have relevant skills and industry experience, please apply if not then candidates can opt for Skill enhancement.<br>For getting help with interviews please visit<br>https://www.synergisticit.com/interview-questions/<br>REQUIRED SKILLS for Java /Software Programmers<br>· Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT<br>· Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive<br>· Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle<br>· Project work on the skills<br>· Knowledge of Core Java, java script, C++ or software programming<br>· Spring boot, Micro-services, Docker, Jenkins and REST API's experience<br>· Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br>For data Science/Machine learning<br>REQUIRED SKILLS<br>· Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT<br>· Project work on the technologies needed<br>· Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive<br>· Experience in the programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle<br>· Knowledge of Statistics, SAS, Python, Computer Vision, and data visualization tools<br>· Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br>Preferred skills: NLP, Text mining, Tableau, Power BI, Time series analysis<br>Please understand skills and relevant experience on real-world projects are required by clients for selection even if it's a Junior or entry-level position the additional skills and Project work with hands-on experience building projects at the client site are the only way a candidate can be picked by clients. If not having the skills or hands-on project work at the client site, candidates can opt for skill enhancement to gain the required skills and project work. No third-party candidates or c2c candidates<br>please only apply to the posting

title: Sustainability Data Analyst
description: At Wilson, we are here to empower every human to live like an athlete. Passion. Creativity. Integrity. Teamwork. Ambition. Innovation. These are the qualities that have made Wilson Sporting Goods Co. the number one sports equipment brand in the world. We come together to win, grow, and celebrate. We all play for Team Wilson. We all have a role to play within our organization and are working towards the same goal. One team, one dream.<p><br></p>We believe that being an athlete isn’t something you do, it’s who you are. It’s a universal code of conduct, a way of seeing the world and how you show up every day. We seek out diverse voices and welcome all perspectives. Our team is composed of individuals with unique backgrounds, points of view and experiences. These perspectives create a rich and diverse culture in which we learn from one another through empathy and inclusion.<p><br></p>Evolving the sports world and being the best partner for players, athletes, and our community is no small task. We are continually looking to add enthusiastic, ambitious, team-first individuals who desire to make a difference —and who love to help others win. Together, we will create a better world through sport. Join us.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p>To make a better world through sport, Wilson is focused on elevating our commitment to sustainability. We are currently seeking a <strong>Sustainability Data Analyst</strong> that can master data management for Wilson’s sustainability strategy. You will spend your time improving and perfecting data collection, analysis, and integrity across environmental categories such as emissions (Scope 1, 2, and 3) energy, waste, water, and life cycle assessments. You will work closely with the Sustainability Director to support environmental reporting for internal and external stakeholders. The Data Analyst will bring insights and ideas to the table while developing data collection and reporting methods in line with industry best practices.<p><br></p><strong><u>Specific Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Identify appropriate methodologies for and evaluating sustainability metrics related to Wilson's sustainability goals and reporting initiatives. </li><li> Collection, analysis, verification and reporting of environmental data required for different sustainability reports and assessments following GRI standards – annual Wilson Impact Report, internal reporting, responding to third-party requests (i.e. CDP), and Life Cycle Assessments. </li><li> Work with stakeholders across the company to identify, track, manage, and report on our Scope 1,2, and 3 emissions data. </li><li> Manage the development of processes, tools, and infrastructure required to manage and track all sustainability data. </li><li> Conduct environmental footprint analysis, working with internal and external partners to calculate our overall carbon footprint. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We're Looking For</u></strong><p><br></p>This role requires a bachelor’s degree or diploma in a related field such as Data Science, Sustainability, Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, or Sustainable Business Leadership plus 1-3 years of experience in an analytics role in a relevant field pertaining to energy efficiency, renewables, water, or waste management.<p><br></p><strong><u>Other Qualifications Include</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A passion for people, planet, and product </li><li> Experience managing and reporting sustainability data </li><li> Experience working cross-functionally in a matrixed organization with a fast-paced and changing culture </li><li> Knowledge of current climate, conservation, sustainability, and CSR issues and topics </li><li> Experienced with calculating carbon emissions, familiar with the Higg suite of tools, and can demonstrate an ability to build effective data visualizations </li><li> Previous experience with GHG accounting (GHG Protocol) or have carbon accounting certification and a strong understanding of greenhouse gas metrics and reporting standards </li><li> Advanced Excel skills and the ability to build data dashboards </li><li> Ability to find trends in the data, articulate the “so what,” and translate insights into strategic, practical recommendations </li><li> Must be an independent, strategic, and creative problem solver with a team mentality </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We’ll Provide</u></strong><p><br></p>We offer an innovative, inclusive, and people-first environment with competitive benefits and perks, including:<p><br></p><ul><li> Paid time off for part- and full-time employees </li><li> Education reimbursement </li><li> Medical, dental and vision </li><li> Pre-tax transit discounts </li><li> 401(k) with company match </li><li> Life insurance </li><li> Paid parental leave </li><li> Professional development opportunities </li><li> Volunteering programs </li><li> Team-building outings </li><li> Discounts on Wilson and Amer Sports products </li></ul><p><br></p>Wilson Sporting Goods Co. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

title: Data Analyst (IT)
description: <strong>Job#: 1359885</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Project Overview: This contract position will participate in a variety of data and analytics projects with an initial focus on data governance audits.<p><br></p>Data Governance Audit initiative addresses: Use of the Collibra Enterprise Cloud (CEC) tool will help support and sustain better data governance and metadata management processes. WM is required to build out the WM Data Catalog and show progress toward the adoption of the tool.<p><br></p>Global Privacy Audit initiative addresses: Any active application - that has PII data - is to have a control in place to delete or anonymize PII data that is past retention according to the Retention Schedule. Applications can only hold onto records if they were placed on a Legal Hold. Partners need to evidence that the control is working effectively.<p><br></p>Additional data and analytics projects focusing on business growth initiatives as aligned to the candidates data management skills and experience<p><br></p>Contractors Role: For the audits, this role will consult on the identification and definition of Critical Data Elements (CDEs), will engage with business stewards and IT data custodians to collect metadata and data lineage to be loaded into Collibra, and will partner with the Wealth Management Data Quality Control team to monitor CDE data quality. For other data and analytics projects, this role will participate in activities related to defining data requirements, hands on data analysis, data science, and data visualization. Projects will be aligned to the candidate based on their data management skills and experience.<p><br></p>Experience Level:<p><br></p>Level 3- [senior- 8+ years overall experience]<p><br></p>Qualifications (Must Haves):<p><br></p>Experience across a broad spectrum of data governance, data quality, and data analytics projects is a must have.<p><br></p>Experience with Metadata Management, Data Quality Management, and Reference and Data Domain Management<p><br></p>Experience with Collibra or other comparable metadata catalogs (e.g.: Informatica, Infosphere IGC, Talend, Alation)<p><br></p>Experience setting and resolving Naming Conventions, Taxonomies, and Ontologies<p><br></p>Nice to Haves: Prior experience related to:<p><br></p>Creating data quality rules in Collibra OwlDQ or Oracle EDQ<p><br></p>Projects dealing with Information Security, Data Privacy, Document Retention, Individual Rights<p><br></p>Experience as a product owner on Agile data products<p><br></p>Data Analytics &amp; Data Presentation (PowerBI experience is highly desired)<p><br></p>Data analysis with SQL, Python, R, etc<p><br></p>Business analysis experience on data projects<p><br></p>Data Modeling<p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [email protected] or 844-463-6178.<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.<p><br></p>4400 Cox Road<p><br></p>Suite 200<p><br></p>Glen Allen, Virginia 23060<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Data Engineer
description: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Technology (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Data Engineer - 100266<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Onsite Position<p><br></p>This position is eligible for a flexible work schedule arrangement at the present time. The arrangement may be delayed for training or other job acclimation purposes and remains subject to change.<p><br></p><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As a <strong>Data Engineer</strong>, for <strong>John Deere Financial (JDF) group </strong>located in <strong>Chicago, IL,</strong> you will join a team to create data products to enable efficient customer services in various area such as automatic loan approvals. Our team partners with product managers and data practitioners to design, scale, and deliver full stack data solutions. In this role you will:<p><br></p><ul><li> Develop data products and data pipeline, build rest APIs to provide data to downstream systems </li><li> Perform debugging and fixing application issues, root cause analysis and help in proactive/preventive maintenance </li><li> Follow test driven development approach </li><li> Help in technical debt reduction and follow clean code principles </li><li> Follow Security by design principles to define security framework around data pipelines and APIs </li><li> Work as Agile team member and participate in back log refinement, sprint planning, sprint review, sprit retrospective </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is NOT Available for this position.</strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need (Required Skills/experiences)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 2 or more years of experience with ETL, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, and working with large-scale datasets </li><li> 2 or more years of API Development experience (specifically Rest APIs using Java, Spring boot) </li><li> 2 or more years of Test-driven development </li><li> 2 or more years of experience leveraging DevOps and lean development principles such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery/Deployment using tools like Git, Jenkins, etc. </li><li> Working knowledge of Data Engineering and the respective tools and technologies (e.g., Apache Spark, Databricks, Python, SQL DB, NoSQL DB, Data Lake concepts) </li><li> Working Knowledge of AWS services such as Lambda, RDS, ECS, API Gateway, S3 etc. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What Makes You Stand Out (Desired Skills/experiences)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> General understanding of AWS services </li><li> Passionate, creative and have the desire to learn new complex technical areas </li><li> Accountable , curious, and collaborative with an intense focus on product quality </li><li> Skilled in interpersonal communications and ability to communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences </li><li> Experience working in an agile team environment </li><li> Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, collaborative team environment that is distributed across time zones and locations. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Ideally you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's or higher degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or equivalent experience in a related career field </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p><br></p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL<p><br></p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.<p><br></p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.<p><br></p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice<p><br></p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.
description_json: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Technology (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Data Engineer - 100266<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Onsite Position<p><br></p>This position is eligible for a flexible work schedule arrangement at the present time. The arrangement may be delayed for training or other job acclimation purposes and remains subject to change.<p><br></p><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As a <strong>Data Engineer</strong>, for <strong>John Deere Financial (JDF) group </strong>located in <strong>Chicago, IL,</strong> you will join a team to create data products to enable efficient customer services in various area such as automatic loan approvals. Our team partners with product managers and data practitioners to design, scale, and deliver full stack data solutions. In this role you will:<p><br></p><ul><li> Develop data products and data pipeline, build rest APIs to provide data to downstream systems </li><li> Perform debugging and fixing application issues, root cause analysis and help in proactive/preventive maintenance </li><li> Follow test driven development approach </li><li> Help in technical debt reduction and follow clean code principles </li><li> Follow Security by design principles to define security framework around data pipelines and APIs </li><li> Work as Agile team member and participate in back log refinement, sprint planning, sprint review, sprit retrospective </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is NOT Available for this position.</strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need (Required Skills/experiences)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 2 or more years of experience with ETL, Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, and working with large-scale datasets </li><li> 2 or more years of API Development experience (specifically Rest APIs using Java, Spring boot) </li><li> 2 or more years of Test-driven development </li><li> 2 or more years of experience leveraging DevOps and lean development principles such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery/Deployment using tools like Git, Jenkins, etc. </li><li> Working knowledge of Data Engineering and the respective tools and technologies (e.g., Apache Spark, Databricks, Python, SQL DB, NoSQL DB, Data Lake concepts) </li><li> Working Knowledge of AWS services such as Lambda, RDS, ECS, API Gateway, S3 etc. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What Makes You Stand Out (Desired Skills/experiences)</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> General understanding of AWS services </li><li> Passionate, creative and have the desire to learn new complex technical areas </li><li> Accountable , curious, and collaborative with an intense focus on product quality </li><li> Skilled in interpersonal communications and ability to communicate complex topics to non-technical audiences </li><li> Experience working in an agile team environment </li><li> Demonstrated ability to function in a fast paced, collaborative team environment that is distributed across time zones and locations. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Ideally you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's or higher degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or equivalent experience in a related career field </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. title: Data Engineer
description: Brand/Omnichannel Analytics Data Engineering<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Guide and execute the build-out and improvement of the brand analytics and marketing analytics and enablement data ecosystem, including the marketing/customer data, promotional data and analytics data layer. Work in close collaboration with all marketing and sales support teams, including Commercial Insights, Data Strategy, Information Systems (IS), Omnichannel Strategy and Operations (OSO), and Field Analytics.</li><li> Provide ongoing operational support for current/active data mart functionality and drive greater efficiencies through continued analysis and improvement of analytics-ready data sets, process refinement, documentation and education. Serve as primary point of contact for all data-related support. Manage business requirements and data solution designs responsible for implementing omni-channel programs and day-to-day operations of the omnichannel and brand analytics teams.</li><li> Evolve data capabilities roadmap and drive adoption of future capabilities, environment enhancements and necessary process improvements. Partner with AWS infrastructure team and Information Systems (IS) to maintain and expand database capabilities by ensuring the analytics vision is supported while defining business and user requirements, release roadmaps, and stakeholder coordination.</li><li> Manage and maintain customer and customer engagement data sources, derived analytics-ready data, including those required to build customer 360 database. Establish and maintain standards, business rules, and processes for data sourcing, on-boarding, and ingestion. Partner with IS on data utilization for and integration with analytics and marketing automation capability. Define and document business rules that translate campaign requirements into technical specifications. Support implementation, execution and ongoing assessment of analytics-derived recommendations, including target lists, next best action suggestions, and alerts, by applying appropriate business/ compliance rules, developing tools to support effective communications/ reporting to key stakeholders, and partnering internal and external stakeholders to manage data loading to/from Astellas production systems.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Master’s degree or the foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field, and 24-36 months of experience in the same or closely similar role.<p><br></p>Alternate Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or the foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field, and 48-60 months of experience in the same or closely similar role.<p><br></p>Three (3) or more years of experience operating in a matrix environment, and involving all of the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Handling commercial data management, including data modeling, data extraction, data transformation, data load, data validation &amp; reconciliation, and data centralization from multiple relational databases.</li><li> Managing the design, implementation, and execution of robust data integration processes and data flows between the data warehouse and source/target systems.</li><li> Handling project management including planning, task prioritization, objective setting, meeting management, and documentation.</li><li> Data management across the following systems and tools: java, Talend ETL, AWS, Redshift</li><li> Proficiency in SQL and working knowledge of R and/or Python</li></ul>

Work in close collaboration with all marketing and sales support teams, including Commercial Insights, Data Strategy, Information Systems (IS), Omnichannel Strategy and Operations (OSO), and Field Analytics.</li><li> Provide ongoing operational support for current/active data mart functionality and drive greater efficiencies through continued analysis and improvement of analytics-ready data sets, process refinement, documentation and education. title: ETL Developer / Data Analyst
description: Location(s)<p><br></p>Alpharetta, Georgia, Birmingham, Alabama, Chicago, Illinois, Dallas, Texas, Downers Grove, Illinois, Jacksonville, Florida, St. Louis, Missouri<p><br></p><strong>Details</strong><p><br></p><em> Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises. </em><p><br></p>Kemper is seeking a candidate with strong Data Analyst and ETL Development skills for the Enterprise Data Services team to assist in data analysis and ETL development. Work with technology and business partners to design, develop, and implement ETL solutions using SQL, IICS and Snowflake. Work with the technical project team to ensure technical requirements are documented, communicated, and implemented.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Data analysis and requirements documentation</li><li>ETL design and development</li><li>Document data mapping</li><li>Research data related inquiries</li><li>Communicate and discuss requirements and data with various project stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working knowledge of SQL (TSQL/PL SQL), ETL patterns and tools and Data Warehouses/ Data Lakes</li><li>3 or more years data analysis or ETL Developer experience</li><li>Experience with databases - Snowflake is required</li><li>Experience with ETL tools - IICS (IDMC) is required</li><li>IT Business/Technical Systems Analyst experience</li><li>Experience with data mapping, modelling, lineage, governance and management a plus</li><li>Effective, clear and concise verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Good organizational and problem-solving skills</li><li>Business Intelligence/Cloud/AWS knowledge or experience preferred</li><li>Education equivalent to a college degree in information technology or technical related discipline, or the equivalent in related work experience</li><li> This position will be located in Jacksonville, FL, Chicago, IL, Alpharetta, GA or Birmingham, AL (Hybrid schedule – one day in the office per week) </li><li>Sponsorship is not offered for this position.</li></ul><p><br></p><em> Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We are committed to supporting diversity and equality across our organization and we work diligently to maintain a workplace free from discrimination. Kemper is focused on expanding our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts to align with our vision, mission, and guiding principles. Kemper does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Kemper and Kemper will not be obligated to pay a placement fee. </em><p><br></p>Kemper will never request personal information, such as your social security number or banking information, via text or email. Additionally, Kemper does not use external messaging applications like WireApp or Skype to communicate with candidates. If you receive such a message, delete it.<p><br></p>

title: Data Engineer
description: Description <br><br>The Data Engineer will be supporting both JCR's domestic and international eProducts. As JCR acquires more customers, their data is continuing to grow and environment is not sustainable. The Data Engineer will be critical in the advisement on best practices, ways to improve and implement solutions to meet the customer's needs. The data is all external customer data so the Data Engineer will create ease of customer access to the data and ability to extract. Additionally, the Data Engineer will help structure the data for reporting and align best ways for supporting it.<br><br> Summary <br><br>Seeking an experienced data engineer with deep knowledge of data and analytics technologies, methodologies, architectures, and processes. Expertise in relational data analysis, data design, and ETL methods is required. This candidate will have a proven record of requirements analysis, problem solving, and solution design. In addition, the candidate must demonstrate an ability to collaborate well with team by exhibiting strong collaboration skills, team and customer focus, and an ability to work with SR management.<br><br> Position Accountabilities <br><ul><li> Assembling large, complex sets of data that meet non-functional and functional business requirements. Manage and aggregate data for analytic consumption.</li><li> Identifying, designing, and implementing internal process improvements including re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, optimizing data delivery, and automating manual processes.</li><li> Building required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Microsoft technologies.</li><li> Building analytical tools to utilize the data pipeline, providing actionable insight into key business performance metrics including operational efficiency and customer acquisition.</li><li> Working with stakeholders including data, design, product, and executive teams and assisting them with data-related technical issues.</li><li> Working with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues.</li><li> Design, develop and deploy optimal monitoring and testing strategy for the data products.</li><li> Collaborate with stakeholders and advanced analytics business partners to understand business needs and translate requirements into scalable data engineering solutions.</li><li> Collaborate with data visualization and reporting application developers to ensure the sustainability of production applications and reports.</li><li> Collaborate with data architects on the enhancement of enterprise data architecture and platforms.</li><li> Research, evaluate and recommend emerging data and analytics technologies based on business and operational needs and requirements.</li><li> Perform routine administration to keep the enterprise data systems, services, and processes secure and healthy.<br><br></li></ul> Position Requirements <br><br>Tech Stack:<br><ul><li> SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, SQL, Azure Synapse - data pipelines, Power BI Datasets.</li><li> Azure tech stack – storage explorer, blob store, databricks, Azure SQL database/DWH, Azure functions, Azure Devops (automated CI/CD), build and release pipelines and DataOps.<br><br></li></ul> General <br><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related quantitative field of study with 4+ years of data architecture, data analysis, data modeling</li><li> Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehouse concepts, and data integration best practices.</li><li> Strong understanding of data quality and validation techniques, including data profiling, data cleansing, and data reconciliation.</li><li> Extensive hands-on experience in data warehousing design, ETL/ELT, BI process development and applying modern data management frameworks and methodologies.</li><li> Hands-on experience implementing full-cycle cloud enterprise data warehousing (EDW) projects.</li><li> Ability to assess rapidly changing technologies and apply them to business needs.</li><li> Security conscientiousness towards all work performed.</li><li> Knowledge and experience in Windows and Linux operating system</li><li> Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, and interpersonal skills. Basic ability to work independently and manage one’s time.<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>ssis, ssrs, ssas, sql, azure, data pipelines, power bi, databricks, azure devops<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>ssis,ssrs,ssas,sql,azure,data pipelines,power bi,databricks,azure devops<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Systems Engineer - Security (Chicago/Hybrid)
description: Work. Serve. Thrive.Imagine a place where your talent can make a meaningful difference in peoples' lives. Working at Feeding America is a uniquely rewarding experience in which our employees work together as vital parts of a much larger mission. We are innovative, mission-focused, diverse, collaborative, values-driven and focused on results.Feeding America is the nation's second largest charity and the leading domestic hunger-relief charity in the United States. Our mission is to feed America's hungry through a nationwide network of member food banks and engage our country in the fight to end hunger. Learn more about Feeding Americahere. This position is based out of Feeding America's newer office location in the heart of downtown Chicago. At Feeding America, we believe in offering a flexible work environment. Employees can be in the office an average of 2 days a week (when not travelling for work) and work from home on other days. Employees also have access to a 30-day "work anywhere" program during the course of each calendar year that can be combined with PTO and/or holidays.The OpportunityThis position will report to the Director, Systems Engineer - Security. The Systems Engineer will help evaluate current security needs and interface cross-functionally with other IT departments, help prioritize and remediate weaknesses in Feeding America's security profile. Work with the Director of Security Engineering to improve processes, craft policies and procedures, and evaluate security technologies.Salary Range: $78,000 to $98,000+ Based on ExperienceResponsibilities: Lead efforts with input from the Director of Security Engineering on crafting security policies and procedures. Work with IT leadership and Infrastructure to manage vulnerability assessments and remediation efforts. Conduct security audits to determine password policy compliance, endpoint protection, privileged access, etc. Help craft and enforce standard configuration for Windows servers and workstations, as well as Cisco networking gear. Participate in designing/managing IT Security strategy including both infrastructure and applications. Be an active member of Design &amp; Build IT projects, steering cloud configurations and services toward industry-leading security best practices. Provide mitigation recommendations to reduce identified security risks. Work with IT leadership to conduct annual IT Risk Assessment process that roles into the organization's risk management process. Evaluate security technologies as needs are identified. Be able to work with a project manager and system engineers as necessary to implement new security technologies and standards. Work with Director to continue to develop and enhance Feeding America's cybersecurity practice. Possess oral and written communication skills to work with technical and non-technical folks to implement policies, procedures, and practices necessary to improve our cybersecurity posture and mitigate identified risks.Cultivate and disseminate knowledge of security best practices.Required Experience and Qualifications:Cybersecurity certification/accreditation is a plus. Must possess a clear understanding of security protocols &amp; standards, best practices, and technologies and have experience with software/security architectures. Experience with Microsoft Azure security IAM and PAM. Demonstrated experience in EDR and XDR platforms. Understanding of Vulnerability Scoring, NVTs, CVEs, and SCAP. Demonstrated experience in crafting security policies, procedures, and standards. Experience in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment and remediation. Experience with auditing and testing in regard to enforcement of policies, procedures, and standards. Demonstrated involvement with the security community and possessing a security certification is a plus. Demonstrated experience in forensics investigations and knowledge of forensics tools is a plus.Foundational RequirementsMission Focused:Demonstrates a commitment to Feeding America's mission through work and action. Is committed to people keep people facing hunger at the center of our work and strives to translate this commitment into action on a daily basis. Willing to advocate for people facing hunger and serve as an ambassador for Feeding America inside and outside of work.Embraces Equity, Diversity and Inclusion:Demonstrates a personal commitment to valuing different background and life experiences through word and action. Takes personal actions to build an inclusive culture that ensures everyone can fully contribute based on their unique talents, skills and perspectives and feels welcomed and valued. Commits to driving equitable solutions to address root cause issues by incorporating an equity framework in their daily work. Committed to continuous personal EDI development.Required Leadership Competencies:Leverages Functional Expertise: Uses advanced functional knowledge to shape decisions and plans. Takes initiative to stay current and apply knowledge of own field, including to improve processes, practices, and policies. Regularly offers to share functional expertise with others to help them succeed.Manages for Results/Delegates Effectively: Holds self and others accountable for meeting measurable goals and performance expectations. Identifies multiple ways to achieve results, takes decisive action, and brings projects to completion in the timeline expected. Establishes regular status checks to maintain and report progress toward goals. Provides helpful, supportive feedback to others. Engages those closest to a situation to make decisions or recommendations.Collaborates Internally and Externally: Leads cross-functional work groups and is regularly sought out to work collaboratively on problem-solving teams. Networks and fosters relationships with external partners to achieve long-term mutually beneficial outcomes. Promotes constructive conversations that challenge ideas and consider alternative points of view about issues and options. Models positive engagement in resolving conflict and elevates a focus on mission and what is best for the people we serve. Avoids finger-pointing and preserves others' reputations, even in challenging situations.Continuously Improves: Forms and sustains effective working relationships that accelerate goal achievement by reaching out to and engaging people from other functions or from outside the organization. Coordinates projects and plans with others within and outside of own area to ensure the work goes smoothly. Pursues networking opportunities and encourages others to form new relationships that benefit all parties. Handles conflict directly and adeptly, respecting all points of view, and resolves issues to create a united path forward.Communicates Effectively: Conveys clear and effective messages using verbal and written communication within individual, small group, and formal presentation settings. Communicates project/operating priorities and updates to key stakeholder audiences that may include staff, network food bank members, donors, and other groups. Responds positively to requests to share information while maintaining confidentiality of sensitive content. Adjusts message and content based on feedback provided.Feeding America recognizes and values diversity. Our goal is to attract, develop, retain, and promote a talented diverse workforce where all employees feel a sense of belonging andcontribute to a culture that values differences, ideas, and experiences. We intentionally seek out diverse perspectives and skills on our teams, knowing that it makes us stronger as an organization and better equipped to serve our neighbors in need. We encourage individuals from historically under-represented communities and individuals with lived experience of hunger to apply.PDN-9995e12a-2c1b-4e51-99d8-d4c4541ec868

title: Applications Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Metra is one of the largest and most complex commuter rail systems in North America, serving Cook, DuPage, Will, Lake, Kane, and McHenry Counties. The agency is linking communities in Northeastern Illinois by providing safe, reliable, and efficient commuter service.<p><br></p>Information Technology is divided into four sections: Enterprise Applications, Railroad Applications, Network Services and Systems Development. The Enterprise Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used enterprise-wide at Metra, such as the new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and HR, Payroll and Timekeeping systems. The Railroad Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used to support Metra’s Transportation, Mechanical, and Engineering functions. The Network Services section has two distinct groups: IT Support and Network Operations. IT Support maintains and supports the agency’s personal computers as well as computer aided design (CAD) systems for the Engineering Department and point-of-sale terminals. Network Operations builds and maintains the servers and storage that are replacing the agency’s mainframe, the data network, e-mail system and disaster recovery capabilities. Systems Development develops, maintains and supports all application systems built in-house, across all business functions.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Senior Manager, New Technology Development, the Systems Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing high-quality user interfaces, web applications, and native iOS applications, ensuring they are user-friendly and reliable.<p><br></p>The primary duties include: Web App Development: Develop web applications throughout the entire software development life cycle with the use of multiple frameworks, languages and scripts including Sharepoint,ASP.NET, C#, PHP, Javascript, Microsoft SQL, MySQL and other database technologies. Implement and execute testing procedures throughout the deployment life cycle for both internally developed and vendor provided applications. Mobile App Development: Design, develop, and implement high-quality iOS applications that meet user needs and business requirements. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code using Swift, Objective-C, and other related iOS development frameworks such as SwiftUI. Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure quality and scalability. Participate in the iOS Mobil App release process including submitting iOS Apps to the App Store and ensuring they meet Apple's guidelines and requirements. User Experience (UX)/ User Interface(UI) Design: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, developers, and stakeholders, to identify business goals and user needs and translate them into user-centered design solutions that deliver value to the user. Work with business units to develop user stories/use cases, wire-frames, user flows, prototypes, and high-quality mock-ups that effectively communicate design concepts and user interactions. Stay up-to-date with the latest UX/UI design trends, tools, and technologies, and incorporate them into design processes and applications as appropriate. Plan and deploy system upgrades and updates to ensure that applications are properly maintained and adhere to best security practices. Work with the Systems Development Team on quality assurance efforts to develop test plans and perform unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing to ensure the quality and stability of applications. Write and maintain documentation of application infrastructure, configuration, function, and testing to include determining documentation requirements, designing business and technical diagrams, technical documents, and end-user functional documents. Develop and maintain design systems, style guides, and UI kits that ensure consistency and cohesiveness across application development efforts. Perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.<p><br></p>Final salary will be determined in part by the qualifications of the selected candidate.<p><br></p>Metra is a railroad employer subject to the provisions of the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, not the Social Security Administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in a computer related discipline OR in lieu of a specified degree any combination of education and experience may be substituted for the required degree that equals four years in application development.</li><li>Must have three years of progressively responsible experience in analysis and design, coding and testing, installation and training in both iOS and web application development, that includes one or more of the following programming/scripting languages: ASP.NET, C#, PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript.</li><li>Experience with RESTful web services and JSON/XML, relational database concepts and technology including Microsoft SQL and MySQL, and working in Windows (client and server) environments.</li><li>Considerable knowledge of of Object-oriented programming principles, design patterns, algorithms, multithreading, and data structures.</li><li>Considerable knowledge and understanding of translating business requirements into technology solutions. Considerable knowledge and understanding of iOS APIs, frameworks, capabilities, UI styles, and paradigms.</li><li>Considerable knowledge and understanding of relational databases, querying and reporting.</li><li>Knowledge of railroad-centric technologies with a focus on communications and tracking technologies that will allow for the development of new applications to support customer's needs.</li><li>Knowledge of Active Directory (AD) technology and structure with the ability to apply and maintain AD aware applications.</li><li>Knowledge of continuous integration.</li><li>Knowledge of best practices in the implementation of front-end UI and UX.</li><li>Good analytical, debugging, and problem solving skills.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communications skills.</li><li>Strong interpersonal and customer service skills in dealing with employees, external customer/groups, and organizations.</li><li>Proficiency working in Windows (client and server) environments and code versioning tools (e.g. Git, Mercurial or SVN).</li><li>Must be detailed oriented and possess project management skills.</li><li>Skill using development tools, software, libraries, and deployment management tools such as Swift, SwiftUI, Microsoft Visual Studio, Laravel, Git, and AWS/Azure Cloud Services.</li><li>Ability to work well both individually and on team based projects.</li><li>Ability to handle multiple tasks, establish priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. </li><li>Must be willing to travel within Metra’s 6-county region.</li><li>Must be available to work flexible hours in the early morning, late afternoon, evenings, or weekends.</li><li>Must be available on-call 24-hours/day, 7 days/week, 365 days/year, including weekends and holidays.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Please note:</strong> Regardless of any state laws that legalize marijuana, Metra prohibits applicants and employees’ use or possession of marijuana (or marijuana paraphernalia), or having detectable amounts of marijuana in their bodies, including synthetic and/or non-synthetic substances such as THC for any reason for pre-employment screening purposes, while on duty, subject to duty, on Metra property, or in Metra work equipment and vehicles.<p><br></p>Metra is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is our policy to fill vacant positions with qualified candidates without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or any protected categories, assuming an individual can perform the essential functions of the job with or without accommodation.
description_json: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Metra is one of the largest and most complex commuter rail systems in North America, serving Cook, DuPage, Will, Lake, Kane, and McHenry Counties. The agency is linking communities in Northeastern Illinois by providing safe, reliable, and efficient commuter service.<p><br></p>Information Technology is divided into four sections: Enterprise Applications, Railroad Applications, Network Services and Systems Development. The Enterprise Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used enterprise-wide at Metra, such as the new Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system and HR, Payroll and Timekeeping systems. The Railroad Applications team is charged with implementing and supporting applications used to support Metra’s Transportation, Mechanical, and Engineering functions. The Network Services section has two distinct groups: IT Support and Network Operations. IT Support maintains and supports the agency’s personal computers as well as computer aided design (CAD) systems for the Engineering Department and point-of-sale terminals. Network Operations builds and maintains the servers and storage that are replacing the agency’s mainframe, the data network, e-mail system and disaster recovery capabilities. Systems Development develops, maintains and supports all application systems built in-house, across all business functions.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Senior Manager, New Technology Development, the Systems Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing high-quality user interfaces, web applications, and native iOS applications, ensuring they are user-friendly and reliable.<p><br></p>The primary duties include: Web App Development: Develop web applications throughout the entire software development life cycle with the use of multiple frameworks, languages and scripts including Sharepoint,ASP.NET, C#, PHP, Javascript, Microsoft SQL, MySQL and other database technologies. Implement and execute testing procedures throughout the deployment life cycle for both internally developed and vendor provided applications. Mobile App Development: Design, develop, and implement high-quality iOS applications that meet user needs and business requirements. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code using Swift, Objective-C, and other related iOS development frameworks such as SwiftUI. Participate in code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure quality and scalability. Participate in the iOS Mobil App release process including submitting iOS Apps to the App Store and ensuring they meet Apple's guidelines and requirements. User Experience (UX)/ User Interface(UI) Design: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, developers, and stakeholders, to identify business goals and user needs and translate them into user-centered design solutions that deliver value to the user. Work with business units to develop user stories/use cases, wire-frames, user flows, prototypes, and high-quality mock-ups that effectively communicate design concepts and user interactions. Stay up-to-date with the latest UX/UI design trends, tools, and technologies, and incorporate them into design processes and applications as appropriate. Plan and deploy system upgrades and updates to ensure that applications are properly maintained and adhere to best security practices. Work with the Systems Development Team on quality assurance efforts to develop test plans and perform unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing to ensure the quality and stability of applications. Write and maintain documentation of application infrastructure, configuration, function, and testing to include determining documentation requirements, designing business and technical diagrams, technical documents, and end-user functional documents. Develop and maintain design systems, style guides, and UI kits that ensure consistency and cohesiveness across application development efforts. Perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.<p><br></p>Final salary will be determined in part by the qualifications of the selected candidate.<p><br></p>Metra is a railroad employer subject to the provisions of the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, not the Social Security Administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in a computer related discipline OR in lieu of a specified degree any combination of education and experience may be substituted for the required degree that equals four years in application development.</li><li>Must have three years of progressively responsible experience in analysis and design, coding and testing, installation and training in both iOS and web application development, that includes one or more of the following programming/scripting languages: ASP.NET, C#, PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript.</li><li>Experience with RESTful web services and JSON/XML, relational database concepts and technology including Microsoft SQL and MySQL, and working in Windows (client and server) environments.</li><li>Considerable knowledge of of Object-oriented programming principles, design patterns, algorithms, multithreading, and data structures.</li><li>Considerable knowledge and understanding of translating business requirements into technology solutions. Considerable knowledge and understanding of iOS APIs, frameworks, capabilities, UI styles, and paradigms.</li><li>Considerable knowledge and understanding of relational databases, querying and reporting.</li><li>Knowledge of railroad-centric technologies with a focus on communications and tracking technologies that will allow for the development of new applications to support customer's needs.</li><li>Knowledge of Active Directory (AD) technology and structure with the ability to apply and maintain AD aware applications.</li><li>Knowledge of continuous integration.</li><li>Knowledge of best practices in the implementation of front-end UI and UX.</li><li>Good analytical, debugging, and problem solving skills.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communications skills.</li><li>Strong interpersonal and customer service skills in dealing with employees, external customer/groups, and organizations.</li><li>Proficiency working in Windows (client and server) environments and code versioning tools (e.g. Git, Mercurial or SVN).</li><li>Must be detailed oriented and possess project management skills.</li><li>Skill using development tools, software, libraries, and deployment management tools such as Swift, SwiftUI, Microsoft Visual Studio, Laravel, Git, and AWS/Azure Cloud Services.</li><li>Ability to work well both individually and on team based projects.</li><li>Ability to handle multiple tasks, establish priorities, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. </li><li>Must be willing to travel within Metra’s 6-county region.</li><li>Must be available to work flexible hours in the early morning, late afternoon, evenings, or weekends.</li><li>Must be available on-call 24-hours/day, 7 days/week, 365 days/year, including weekends and holidays.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Please note:</strong> Regardless of any state laws that legalize marijuana, Metra prohibits applicants and employees’ use or possession of marijuana (or marijuana paraphernalia), or having detectable amounts of marijuana in their bodies, including synthetic and/or non-synthetic substances such as THC for any reason for pre-employment screening purposes, while on duty, subject to duty, on Metra property, or in Metra work equipment and vehicles.<p><br></p>Metra is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is our policy to fill vacant positions with qualified candidates without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or any protected categories, assuming an individual can perform the essential functions of the job with or without accommodation.

description: <p><strong>Position: IBM BPM Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL</strong></p><p><br></p><ol><li>Minimum 8 years of IT Experience with minimum of 5 years IBM BPM Development with certification.</li><li>At least 2 project implementation in IBM BPM 8.0 or above</li><li>Very good written verbal communication Can connect with Business Stakeholders understand the business</li><li>Primary Skills Must have Very good understanding of BPMN 2 0</li><li>Very good knowledge on Coach &amp; BPM UI (Spark UI) implementation</li><li>Good knowledge on REST API its implementation</li><li>Must have implemented Web services integration services controls the flow of process execution decision making and exception management across multiple organizational roles and systems applications</li><li>Tailors user screens for each process activity to enable end users to interact with multiple internal external systems through a single interface</li><li>Good database skills with excellent query writing skills</li><li>Can build the executable processes with limited requirement to showcase business</li><li>Knowledge on Content Management System &amp; its integration with IBM BPM.</li></ol><p><br></p>

title: IBM BPM Developer
description: Help at Home is the leading national provider of in-home personal care services, where our mission is to enable individuals to live with independence and dignity at home. Our team supports 66,000 clients monthly with the help of 50,000 compassionate caregivers across 12 states. We're looking for people who care about others, who are willing to listen, lean in and make impactful change. Each role at Help at Home can have a positive impact in supporting our caregivers and clients. If you are someone who leads with passion and integrity and are looking to join a rapidly growing, industry leading team, Help at Home may be a good fit for you.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Help at Home</strong> is looking to hire an Engineer to work as part of our IT Software Engineering Services practice on HealthCloud development, support and enhancement. This person will need to demonstrate an understanding of software engineering concepts and be responsible for working on full lifecycle engineering efforts using Agile methodologies, object-oriented design, and accepted design patterns and practices. Candidates will be working collaboratively with client and project teams as well as working from proposal &amp; development to deployment and support.<p><br></p><strong><em><strong>As a key member of the team:</strong></em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are flexible and can embrace change</li><li>You value progress over perfection</li><li>You care about your work, the team you're on, and the people we are helping </li><li>You make it a priority to get to know the people around you - build relationships with your colleagues and business partners </li><li>You say what needs to be said, while considering how it'll affect culture and output</li><li> Hold others to a high standard </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong> Responsibilities: </strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop Apex (classes and triggers) and Visualforce to extend Salesforce in order to support business requirements</li><li>Custom User Interface development, including Visualforce pages/Lightning pages, Aura Components and Lightning Web Components</li><li>Integrations: Use Salesforce APIs to integrate with other systems used in the organization</li><li>Best Practices: Adhere to Salesforce best practices, maintain code documentation, and write / maintain test classes for all custom development</li><li>Take ownership of release cycles to implement and deploy new/updates to existing applications and code</li><li>Collaborating with IT / Developers for other systems in order to integrate across the business</li><li>Implement and maintain Salesforce customizations such as custom fields and objects, layouts, workflows, process builder, and validation rules</li><li>Participate in the planning and analysis of business requirements for system changes and enhancements</li><li>Meet with internal stakeholders to determine business, functional and technical requirements and participate in application design, configuration, testing and deployment</li><li>Perform configuration and customization of the platform.</li><li>Utilize best practices to perform operational support, enhancements, bug fixes as needed to the HealthCloud platform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years of experience in administration and development of Salesforce Cloud Functionality</li><li>Experience with Salesforce HealthCloud</li><li>Knowledge of Salesforce data structures, permissions, roles, reports, dashboards, and logical formulas</li><li>Experience developing custom APEX and Visualforce components</li><li>Experience migrating data and customizations across Salesforce environments</li><li>Strong attention to detail, and the ability to multi-task and prioritize tasks</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting skills</li><li>Knowledge of software development processes and best practices</li><li>Working knowledge and experience with complex business systems integration as well as object-oriented design patterns and development</li><li>Experience and expertise in core web technologies including HTML5, Javascript and jQuery</li><li>Software engineering skills with Platform (Apex, VisualForce, SOQL, Unit Testing)</li><li>Demonstrated experience and knowledge of relational databases, data modeling, and ETL tools</li><li>In depth knowledge of REST/SOAP APIs and experience building integrations with </li><li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Required:</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree required - Computer Science, MIS or equivalent</li><li>Excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills</li><li>2+ year's experience with developer toolkit - Apex, VisualForce, IDE, Migration Tool, Web Services/SOA &amp; Metadata APIs</li><li>Experience working on Salesforce platforms or other CRM software packages (Microsoft CRM, InterAction, SalesLogix, Oracle On-Demand, SAP etc.) preferred</li><li>A desire to work with the latest tools, technologies, and methodologies (Platform, Eclipse, Talend Open Studio, Oracle, MySQL, Visual Studio 2012, object relational (O/R) mapping (NHibernate), NUnit)</li><li>A desire to work within a fast-paced, collaborative, and team-based support environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desirable:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Competency in other languages / development (XML, Flex, JavaScript, Java, .NET, SQL, C#, C++, SOAP/REST web services/APIs </li><li> Comfortable managing a team as a technical lead </li><li> Demonstrates continued personal/professional development, </li><li> Active in the Salesforce community. </li><li>Certified Developer Certification(s)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Education and Experience: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>5+ years of business systems and/or data analysis experience</li></ul>

title: Salesforce Engineer - Remote
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Robert Half is looking for a Jr Security Engineer / Help Desk Analyst II to join our team. The ideal candidate for this position has a can-do attitude and is looking to be part of a highly motivated team. We need a Service Desk Analyst who can represent the Service Desk by liaising with 2nd and 3rd level teams to help transition new and changing services. You will need to be comfortable with creating knowledge articles and arranging training for other Service Desk Analysts when needed. You will spend your time handling complex end-user support issues and providing support to team members by focusing on restoring service to the end users. As the Help Desk Analyst, it is important that you understand how your role relates to IT projects and IT Service Management initiatives. It is important for the chosen candidate to understand Incident, Problem, Change Management and other processes. How these processes work together to provide superior support and high availability of our business is also important. Covering alternative shifts when needed is often necessary with this Analyst job. You'll be right for this position if you are a self-confident, motivated person with a strong work ethic and excellent communication skills who enjoys a fast-paced, team-driven environment. This is a long-term contract / temporary opportunity. This Jr Security Engineer / Help Desk Analyst II opportunity will be located in the Chicago, Illinois area and will be a long-term contract / temporary position.<br><br>Major responsibilities<br><ul><li> Provide guidance to Tier 1 support and team members</li><li> Meet and exceed SLA standards: Close tickets in a timely manner, while upholding customer service standards</li><li> Understand concepts related to networks, servers, PCs, databases, proprietary systems, etc.</li><li> Maintain hardware and peripherals: Responsible for upgrading and replacing computer parts; handle documentation and asset inventory</li><li>Security Hardening: Reviewing and implementing security best practices for the organization's infrastructure, particularly in the public cloud environments. This includes conducting security assessments, identifying vulnerabilities, and implementing appropriate controls to mitigate risks.</li><li>Configuration Management: Verifying and ensuring that the AWS and other cloud environments are configured correctly and aligned with the organization's security standards. Making necessary adjustments and recommending changes to meet security requirements.</li><li>Security Compliance: Assisting in maintaining compliance with relevant security standards, frameworks, and regulations. This may involve conducting audits, documenting controls, and supporting compliance-related activities.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision</li><li> Expertise in Windows Intune</li><li> Microsoft Office 365 experience</li><li> 3+ years' of experience supporting desktop/server operating systems and technologies such as Active Directory, DNS, Exchange and VMware</li><li>AWS or Azure environment</li><li>Security Hardening</li><li> Ability to recognize, evaluate, and resolve problems effectively</li><li> Ability to multitask efficiently and prioritize work</li><li> Working knowledge in one or more programming or scripting language</li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li> The ideal candidate should be able to analyze complex business problems, propose effective solutions and understand and apply business vision and direction<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. description: <strong>Job- Business Intelligence Developer<br><br>location - Remote<br><br>Duration - 6 months, 23 days<br></strong><ul><li> The BI Developer collaborates as a member of a project team with academic and administrative units to implement and support business intelligence solutions to satisfy information requirements for planning and decision making, using data from core administrative systems.</li><li> The individual in this position works with a Senior BI Analyst to define BI requirements for individual subject areas, develop conceptual data models, design, build, and test a robust set of reporting and analytic BI deliverables using the standard University BI tool, Business Objects (BO), Tableau and rollout the solution including training and ongoing support.</li><li> The BI developer will work with the training lead to implement training, communication, and support programs across campus.</li><li> This individual will also be a key BI analysis and development resource for new subject areas and reporting deliverable enhancements<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Must have strong experience with Reporting Tools</li><li> Business Objects and Tableau (3-5 years)</li><li> Must have strong experience with writing SQL (3-5 years)</li><li> Good to have experience with Oracle Data Integrator (1 year)</li><li> Good to have experience with Python programming (1 year)</li><li> Good Team Player</li><li> Strong Communication skills</li></ul>
