title: Business Intelligence Developer Business Intelligence Developer
description: <strong>*Secret Clearance Required to Be Considered*<br><br></strong>Designs, develops, troubleshoots, and analyzes computer software. Reviews architecture and selects and integrates appropriate development and support tools to ensure product performance. Investigates, identifies, and resolves code issues logged internally by QA or end users. Develops and maintains documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Works with user groups to solve business problems with available technology including hardware, software, databases, and peripherals.</li><li> Develops and implements processes that enable agile teaming to maximize talent utilization across the customer organization.</li><li> In depth understanding of emerging IT technologies in order to create directorate level business processes</li><li> Partners with various stakeholder organization's to lead planning and business process improvement efforts.</li><li> Establishes needed processes, governance structures, performance metrics and reporting.</li><li> Applies expert functional knowledge and experience to significant business projects or processes.</li><li> Maintains expertise by in-depth involvement in the state-of-the-art research and technology development in the field.</li><li> Monitors and/or participates in industry user forums, working groups in area of expertise.</li><li> As needed, identifies the most qualified internal resources and/or contractor team to assist with tasks. Selects contractors, frames statements of work, and directs the work of the team to assure technical and financial milestones are met.</li><li> May lead a small team of capable technical staff members and advises/mentors developing technical staff, does not have direct management responsibility.</li><li> Coaches and mentors internal staff in associated technical areas of expertise.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in a related field; Master's Degree preferred<br><br>15+ years of experience in a technical field<br><br>Tech Stack/Tool Suite to be used include and which expertise is required<br><ul><li> React 16.11.0</li><li> Bootstrap 4.3.1</li><li> jQuery 1.12.4</li><li> Node.js 10.24.1</li><li> Yarn 1.22.5</li><li> Jest 24.9.0</li><li> Ruby 2.6.8</li><li> Rails 5.1.7</li><li> RubyGems 3.0.3.1</li><li> Rack version 2.2.3</li><li> Rspec 3.10</li><li> MySQL (Rails uses mysql2 gem v0.5.3 as adapter)</li><li> AWS commercial services - SQS, DynamoDB, SNS</li><li> REST APIs</li><li> Angular</li><li> Java</li><li> Python</li><li> Groovy</li><li> Vue v2.0</li><li> Vuetify v1.5</li><li> FeathersJS v6.1</li><li> Sequelize v5.21</li><li> Axios v0.18</li><li> Express.js v4.16</li><li> AWS RDS for PostgreSQL</li><li> AWS Simple Storage Service (S3)</li><li> Docker</li><li> AWS Lambda<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Job Specific Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li> Process oriented, conceptually driven and possess the ability to think strategically and work collaboratively in a highly technical setting.</li><li> Demonstrated success in developing strategic goals and leading complex programs.</li><li> Experience with project development lifecycle and systems operations.</li><li> Proven ability to interact with customers, senior leadership and program managers in a highly matrixed environment.</li><li> Proven ability to develop and extend network of working level contacts to facilitate behind the scenes coordination.</li><li> Proven experience in designing, developing, and delivering executive level communication on organization transformation and business process changes. Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

title: Application Developer
description: <u>Department</u><p><br></p>BSD CTD - Engineering: Plan X - QA<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The Center for Translational Data Science (CTDS) at the University of Chicago is a research center whose mission is to develop the discipline of translational data science to impactful problems in biology, medicine, healthcare, and the environment. We envision a world in which researchers have ready access to the data needed and the tools required to make data driven discoveries that increase our scientific knowledge and improve the quality of life. We architect ecosystems of large-scale commons of research data, computing resources, applications, tools, and services for the broader research community to use data at scale to pursue scientific inquiry and accelerate discovery. Learn more at https://gdc.cancer.gov/ , https://gen3.org/ , https://stats.gen3.org/ , and https://ctds.uchicago.edu/. This at-will position is wholly or partially funded by contractual grant funding which is renewed under provisions set by the grantor of the contract. Employment will be contingent upon the continued receipt of these grant funds and satisfactory job performance.<p><br></p><u><strong>Job Information</strong></u><p><br></p>Software Engineers in Test for various &amp; unanticipated worksites throughout the U.S. (HQ: Chicago, IL). Work with cloud computing infrastructure primarily based on OpenStack to architect and implement quality assurance practices across all phases of the testing lifecycle. Coding includes the full stack including systems orchestration, API development, algorithms and data structures, and user interfaces. Projects span management, sharing, and provenance of large data sets, automation, metrics, and scheduling for cloud computing, large scale pipe lining of next-generation sequence analysis, transfer programs/protocols for high-speed networks and resource visualization. Responsible for creating the project Software Quality Assurance Plan. Create and implement QA Test Plans and SOPs Test functionalities prior to each release on each tier (QA, Stage and Production). Design and evaluate tests. Test the product to be compliant with technical specifications and policy requirements, including unit testing, automated regression testing. Identify necessary teams to successfully complete the Test Phase Contribute to Master Test Plan and Strategy by identifying appropriate test techniques and tools that ensure product quality and test completion. Develop the test case documents according to the Master Test Plan/Test Strategy. Facilitate triage of defects and assist in defect investigation and escalation. Walk through the test results with the team and communicate status to management and project leadership. Assist with the implementation of automated testing tools. Serves as a liaison with internal and external collaborators on various research projects. Technical Environment: Openstack (GDC); Unix/Linux; Python; JavaScript; Go; Kubernetes; Docker; version control.<p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u>Additional Requirements</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Information Systems or related field plus 2 years of experience in the job offered, as a QA Engineer or in software QA/Testing required. Required Skills: all phases of the test lifecycle; design and evaluate tests; test case development, automated regression testing; Unix/Linux; Python; JavaScript; Kubernetes; Docker; version control. Background check including review of conviction history required. May work remote. (*Masters degree in Information Systems or related field plus 1 year of experience in the job offered, as a QA Engineer or in software QA/Testing also acceptable).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Schedule</strong>: Full time<p><br></p><strong>Application Information</strong><p><br></p><em>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.</em><p><br></p>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<p><br></p><u>Benefit Eligibility</u><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong><u>Requires Compliance with University Covid-19 Vaccination Requirement</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Pay Frequency</u><p><br></p>Monthly<p><br></p><u>Pay Range</u><p><br></p><strong><u>Depends On Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><u>Scheduled Weekly Hours</u><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><u>Union</u><p><br></p>Non-Union<p><br></p><u>Job is Exempt</u><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><u>Drug Test Required</u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Health Screen Required</u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Posting Date</u><p><br></p>2023-07-11<p><br></p><u>Remove from Posting On or Before</u><p><br></p>2024-01-11<p><br></p><strong><u>Posting Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<p><br></p>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<p><br></p>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<p><br></p>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: Software Engineer in Test
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong>                   DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong>                     Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)  <p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong>       Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong>                    Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong>: Employer will accept a degree in Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering (any) or related field and 36 months of experience in Lead DevOps Engineer; Senior Software Engineer; Systems Engineer or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: Developing, releasing, and building engineering utilizing DevOps methodology; Utilizing programming languages, including Groovy and scripting tools, including Linux, Bash, and Python; Utilizing Docker and Kubernetes; Utilizing Jenkins for orchestration of Continuous Integration Continuous Deployment (CI/CD), GitHub as version control system, Nexus packages, Artifactory as a private registry for Docker images, Xray for vulnerability scanner, and SonarQube for code quality; Developing declarative style pipeline as code for various application types for CI/CD; Developing infrastructure as code, Terraform modules, and Ansible playbooks for automation; Monitoring cloud native applications deployed in Openshift; Developing software utilizing Openshift, Kubernetes, Docker, and Kubernetes Operators; and Visualizing and documenting architecture and design topology.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $86,174 to $142,500. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Display Systems Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for driving the timely, efficient, and cost-effective design of agriculture and construction equipment display and cluster products. Develop requirements and associated system architecture, system designs, test cases, and acceptance criteria. Interface with the Vehicle Integration Engineers to ensure that the displays are successfully integrated into the target vehicle electrical systems. Harmonize the UI/UX HMI designs with the display component software design. Work with the Safety Engineers to fulfill the necessary Functional Safety requirements (ISO25119). Work with the Network Architecture team to ensure that the displays and clusters meet all applicable protocol standards and performance requirements. Troubleshoot problems and develop root cause through hardware and software failure analysis and testing. Support plants, suppliers, and customers with resolving issues. Support the Project Manager(s) with System Engineering estimates and resource planning. Actively assisting the Project Manager with managing external supplier(s) to ensure that their deliverables meet the project requirements and overall project needs. Aid Project Managers with resource planning. Develop future roadmaps to maximize design commonality for display and cluster products across all vehicle product lines. Salary: $134,120-156,000/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering or directly related field plus five years of experience in product development and developing displays for automotive or commercial vehicles. The five years of experience must include two years of experience with each of the following: 1) developing system requirements, system architecture, system design, and test cases; 2) automotive in-vehicle communications architectures and protocols including CAN, J1939, LIN; 3) creating test plans and test scripts using Python and C++; 4) using CANalyzer for vehicle data measurement and analysis; 5) using MATLAB, Simulink for system development and analysis; 6) UML diagrams for system interfaces and user interfaces; and 7) a requirements management tool.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . description_json: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The Display Systems Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for driving the timely, efficient, and cost-effective design of agriculture and construction equipment display and cluster products. Develop requirements and associated system architecture, system designs, test cases, and acceptance criteria. Interface with the Vehicle Integration Engineers to ensure that the displays are successfully integrated into the target vehicle electrical systems. Harmonize the UI/UX HMI designs with the display component software design. Work with the Safety Engineers to fulfill the necessary Functional Safety requirements (ISO25119). Work with the Network Architecture team to ensure that the displays and clusters meet all applicable protocol standards and performance requirements. Troubleshoot problems and develop root cause through hardware and software failure analysis and testing. Support plants, suppliers, and customers with resolving issues. Support the Project Manager(s) with System Engineering estimates and resource planning. Actively assisting the Project Manager with managing external supplier(s) to ensure that their deliverables meet the project requirements and overall project needs. Aid Project Managers with resource planning. Develop future roadmaps to maximize design commonality for display and cluster products across all vehicle product lines. Salary: $134,120-156,000/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Electronics Engineering or directly related field plus five years of experience in product development and developing displays for automotive or commercial vehicles. The five years of experience must include two years of experience with each of the following: 1) developing system requirements, system architecture, system design, and test cases; 2) automotive in-vehicle communications architectures and protocols including CAN, J1939, LIN; 3) creating test plans and test scripts using Python and C++; 4) using CANalyzer for vehicle data measurement and analysis; 5) using MATLAB, Simulink for system development and analysis; 6) UML diagrams for system interfaces and user interfaces; and 7) a requirements management tool.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Display Systems Engineer
description: <strong>TITLE: Associate QC Analyst </strong><p><br></p><strong>LOCATION: Argo</strong><p><br></p><strong>REPORTS TO: QC Lead</strong><p><br></p>The <strong>Associate QC Analyst </strong>supports the Hydrate Dextrose and Anhydrous Laboratories by performing analytical tests independently and accurately. Meet the needs of internal and external customers in a safe and timely manner on process and product quality.<p><br></p><strong><u>Core Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform methods from the United States Pharmacopeia (USP), American Chemical Society (ACS), Food Chemical Codex (FCC) and other validated procedures independently. </li><li>Perform a variety of tasks/procedures in a fast-paced environment; maintain accurate and complete record of data. </li><li>Prioritize testing based on business needs and ensure testing is performed in an appropriate and timely manner. </li><li>Collect samples of finished products.</li><li>Maintain complete, accurate and legible test records, in accordance with Company policy and record keeping procedure. </li><li>Follow all safety guidelines and quality systems established by Ingredion. </li><li>Develop a working knowledge of product and customers specifications. Disposition product against established specifications. </li><li>Perform other work as assigned by laboratory management.</li><li>Revise and update methods independently. </li><li>Assist in maintenance of equipment, including routine maintenance and resolution of common or simple problems with instruments.</li><li>Communicate technical data to technical and non-technical people, both verbal and written.</li><li>Learn new skills and assist in the training of others.</li><li>Demonstrate organizational skills, prioritize multiple tasks, written, verbal and computer skills</li><li>LSS experience is desired.</li><li>Ability to work in a diverse team environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualified Candidate Will Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Food Science, or related sciences.</li><li>Possess knowledge of laboratory practices</li><li>Cover shifts as needed. Must be available for weekend and after hour coverage.</li><li>Self-starter with a strong work ethic.</li><li>High level of integrity and sincerity.</li><li>Proactive and innovative with a strong will to succeed.</li><li>Ability to communicate at all levels.</li><li>Sound overall knowledge of regulatory rules, policies, procedures in the areas of GMP, Quality, Environmental Management and Health &amp; Safety.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Ingredion provides accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If a job applicant requires an accommodation during the application process or through the selection process, we will work with the applicant to meet the job applicant's accommodation needs.</strong><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, military status, or disability status.<p><br></p><u><strong>Relocation Available:</strong></u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p>

title: Associate Quality Control Analyst
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>Position Overview:<br><br>The Analyst, OS&amp;D (Over, Short &amp; Damage) utilizes the system and data to work with carriers, Logistics Centers (LC), and customers to identify trends and root causes to resolve over, short, and damage issues. The analyst works with the Specialist, OS&amp;D in executing and managing OS&amp;D and a daily basis.<br><br>Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities:<br><ul><li>Identify items, LCs or retailers that have high levels of OS&amp;D; work with appropriate partners to create and implement solutions based on findings</li><li>Provide reporting and actions using standard CJ Logistics America’s tools</li><li>Focus on driving efficiency through the use of new and better technology and/or process improvements</li><li>Train, oversee, and monitor work being performed by CJ Logistics’ employees and contractors </li><li>Receive OS&amp;D notifications from carriers or customers and record them into the CJL system</li><li>Communicate OS&amp;D issues to Logistics Center and customer</li><li>Initiate cycle count requests with our Logistics Centers</li><li>Initiate dock checks with our carriers and with our Logistics Centers</li><li>Manage and coordinate the proper disposition of damage and refused products using the most cost-effective method of transportation</li><li>Ensure product is returned to the appropriate location and enter the return information into the CJL system</li><li>Create daily OS&amp;D reports for distribution to our customers and Logistics Centers</li><li>Assist customers regarding questions as it relates to OS&amp;D and provide proof of delivery as necessary</li><li>May be required to be on call and work as part of a Saturday rotation</li><li>Additional job duties as assigned<br><br></li></ul>Requirements and Qualifications:<br><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree; specialization in Logistics, Transportation or Supply Chain Management is preferred</li><li>3 years of experience in transportation, OS&amp;D, or a service-related position</li><li>Strong skills in MS Excel</li><li>TMS experience is a plus</li><li>Google applications experience</li><li>Strong analytical skills with proven ability to work within a team</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li>Disciplined problem-solving skills</li><li>Results-oriented with good planning, organizational, and time-management skills</li><li>Ability to handle situations, issues, and information with sound judgment, diplomacy, and sensitivity</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment<br><br></li></ul>Pay, Benefits and More:<br><ul><li>Competitive compensation package</li><li>Full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), Life insurance, tuition assistance, PTO and MORE!</li><li>Growing company with a performance record that continues to climb!</li><li>Opportunity to drive significant changes in Talent Acquisition with an ability to make an impact across the organization</li><li>Open-door work environment</li><li>High Performance culture with a focus on a growth mindset where continuous improvement is embraced</li><li>Opportunities for advancement!<br><br></li></ul>CJ Logistics America About Statement:<br><br>CJ Logistics America delivers integrated and multimodal logistics services, connecting every corner of the world via air, sea and land. As a lead logistics partner (LLP), third-party logistics provider (3PL) and supply chain consultant, we help customers leverage supply chain management as a competitive advantage, reducing total system costs, transforming business processes, improving service and facilitating growth and change. With a focus on social responsibility and sustainability through growth with customers and communities, we prioritize the wellbeing of the end consumer, our customers and our employees. CJ Logistics America is responsible for the North America region, specializing in solutions for regulated industries such as food and beverage, consumer-packaged goods, healthcare and medical supplies, and tire and automotive.<br><br>CJ Logistics America is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and or/harassment of any type, including but not limited to discrimination and or harassment based upon race, religion, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, pregnancy or relation medical conditions, childbirth, breastfeeding, parental status, veteran and/or military statue, disability (physical or mental) medical condition, genetic information or characteristics, political affiliation, domestic violence survivor status, marital status, or other characteristics prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Additionally, CJ Logistics America participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations.<br><br>Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Linux Engineer
description: Growing engineering team is seeking an FEA Analyst to create system and subsystem models and simulations to optimize product development. We need an engineer to develop large models of complex systems from concept through bench testing. We need an Engineer to develop analytical methods to advanced tools for optimal product design, finite element analysis, and development.<p><br></p>If you are seeking a fantastic team just north of Chicago, IL, please read on!<p><br></p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING - Model FEA Analyst!</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Finite Element Analysis</li><li>Define simulation, generate statements of work, and define timelines</li><li>Research all relevant marketing specifications</li><li>Develop large models of complex systems involving multiple physics</li><li>Participate in Design reviews</li></ul><strong>WHAT YOU NEED - Modeling and Simulation Engineer</strong><strong>: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Masters</li><li>FEA</li><li>5+ years of System modeling </li><li>Experience with the design, analysis and testing of systems and sub-systems</li><li>Familiar with data acquisition systems</li><li>Experience with troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis for electro-mechanical equipment</li><li>Continuous improvement mindset</li></ul><strong>WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU - FEA Analyst!</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Comprehensive benefits</li><li>Amazing work environment</li><li>Fun and exciting projects</li><li>Much more!</li></ul>So, if you are an FEA Analyst, apply today!

title: OS & D Analyst
description: We're powering a cleaner, brighter future.<p><br></p>Exelon is leading the energy transformation, and we're calling all problem solvers, innovators, community builders and change makers. Work with us to deliver solutions that make our diverse cities and communities stronger, healthier and more resilient.<p><br></p>We're powered by purpose-driven people like you who believe in being inclusive and creative, and value safety, innovation, integrity and community service. We are a Fortune 200 company, 19,000 colleagues strong serving more than 10 million customers at six energy companies -- Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power &amp; Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco).<p><br></p>In our relentless pursuit of excellence, we elevate diverse voices, fresh perspectives and bold thinking. And since we know transforming the future of energy is hard work, we provide competitive compensation, incentives, excellent benefits and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.<p><br></p>Are you in?<p><br></p><ul><li>Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.</li></ul><p><br></p>Note: This is a flex position meaning this role will be part remote and part in the office.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Purpose Of Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Perform activities relating to designing, building, testing, implementing and maintaining software, solutions, products and processes under the guidance of a Sr. Engineer, Scrum Master, Project Manager or Manager. Provide IT teams and business personnel with technology solutions by weighing advantages of technology standards, market availability of products, risks and benefits of technology to meet business/IT needs. May assist in the coordination of tasks for subordinates. Independence level: Works under general supervision. The role will be centered on the development and improvement of new and existing features. Additionally, you will participate in peer code reviews, advocate for standard development methodologies, and participate in an inclusive, energetic and highly cross-functional team. The role encompasses design, implementation, and testing to ensure building products right and release them with high quality.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Duties And Accountabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyze, improve, design, develop, test, deploy and maintain both new and existing solutions that meet established business requirements, in accordance with IT development standards. Contribute to project technical architecture design and development. Solutions may include but are not limited to the development of various types of applications, web, mobile app, full stack or integrations hosted on premises data centers or in the cloud. Develop automated Unit tests and/or automated UI tests. (45%) </li><li> Engage with business and IT partners to ensure business needs are satisfied with practical, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. Writes product specifications and design documentation for assigned system components. (25%) </li><li> Collaborate with other project teams or IT partners to coordinate delivery of solutions and minimize technology risk (10%) </li><li> Actively engage with development team lead on progress, status and issues pertaining to assigned deliverables (10%) </li><li> Enhance knowledge of and compliance with preferred technologies, methodologies, standards and policies. Maintain technical knowledge and business acumen within own discipline or function. Strong debugging and problem-solving skills; participate in peer code reviews. (5%) </li><li> Participate in IT architecture review and standards setting. Assist in the development of white papers, conducting presentations as needed to explain why a technology is being recommended by IT. (5%) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>JOB SCOPE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop and maintain deep knowledge of technology and its application across our business areas or for our customers </li><li> Promote knowledge via seminars, presentations and publications within IT and Exelon </li><li> Participate in technological innovation to drive new business opportunities and solve complex business problems </li><li> Requires moderate skill set and proficiency in discipline. </li><li> Conducts work assignments of increasing complexity, under moderate supervision with some latitude for independent judgment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree (ex: Computer Science or related discipline) and 2 - 5 years of relevant experience (programming technologies) or minimum 6 - 9 years of relevant combination of education and work experience </li><li> Demonstrates strong software development capabilities coupled with the ability to work under tight deadlines. </li><li> Demonstrated strong teamwork skills with self-motivation to achieve success in a rapidly evolving environment. </li><li> Excellent communications skills - Able to effectively communicate highly technical information in non-technical terminology (written and verbal). </li><li> Strong knowledge of Operating Systems - Windows, Solaris or Linux </li><li> Programming Languages: Familiar with 1-2 languages/frameworks (e.g. Java, .Net. C#, html, Angular, typescript, etc.) Database: Familiar with Relational </li><li> Databases and understands basic design techniques, ACID properties, and transactions, can write simple, select statements to retrieve information from the database. </li><li> APIs: Able to write code to consume APIs and can create new API based on the design provided by a senior Engineer </li><li> Troubleshooting: Perform basic independent troubleshooting by looking through logs and can investigate and fix simple code issues. May require help to troubleshoot complex issues </li><li> Experience with Agile software development and test-driven development </li><li> Experience in automated testing including unit testing, UI testing and functional testing </li><li> Able to handle more complex software development and support tasks with supervision. </li><li> Able to create good documentation. </li><li> Consistently implements development best practices. </li><li> Develops working relationships with members outside of core team </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prior experience developing software requirements, designing conceptual data models &amp; system architecture, and user interfaces, is a major plus </li><li> Master's degree in CS (or equivalent field) plus 3 years of relevant experiences </li><li> Demonstrated understanding of what makes good software design, a deeper understanding of programming languages, and an ability to solve engineering problems of increasing difficulty. </li><li> Shows initiative beyond pure implementation. </li><li> Experience building highly scalable applications </li><li> Experience working with SCRUM, Kanban or other Agile development environments </li><li> Self-motivated and able to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines </li><li> Energetic </li><li> Works well with team Curious and eager to learn more </li><li>Experience in Documentum solution as preferred skills</li><li>Experience working in Documentum OpenText product version 16.3 and above </li><li>FileNet (IBM),</li><li>Open Text Content Server</li><li>Documentum Administrator</li><li>Documentum Foundation Classes (DFC java),</li><li>Documentum Foundation Services (DFS web services/SOAP),</li><li>Documentum REST API</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-CHICAGO<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-DC-WASHINGTON, US-IL-OAKBROOK TERRACE, US-MD-BALTIMORE, US-PA-PHILADELPHIA, US-Hybrid Remote<p><br></p><strong>Work Locations</strong><p><br></p>2 Lincoln Centre<p><br></p><strong>Job</strong><p><br></p>Information Technology - Staff<p><br></p><strong>Organization</strong><p><br></p>BSC Information Technology<p><br></p><strong>Schedule</strong><p><br></p>Full-time<p><br></p><strong>Employee Status</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Job Posting</strong><p><br></p>Jul 11, 2023, 4:32:40 PM<p><br></p><strong>Unposting Date</strong><p><br></p>Jul 18, 2023, 11:59:00 PM

Work with us to deliver solutions that make our diverse cities and communities stronger, healthier and more resilient.<p><br></p>We're powered by purpose-driven people like you who believe in being inclusive and creative, and value safety, innovation, integrity and community service. We are a Fortune 200 company, 19,000 colleagues strong serving more than 10 million customers at six energy companies -- Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power &amp; Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco).<p><br></p>In our relentless pursuit of excellence, we elevate diverse voices, fresh perspectives and bold thinking. And since we know transforming the future of energy is hard work, we provide competitive compensation, incentives, excellent benefits and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.<p><br></p>Are you in?<p><br></p><ul><li>Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.</li></ul><p><br></p>Note: This is a flex position meaning this role will be part remote and part in the office.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Purpose Of Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Perform activities relating to designing, building, testing, implementing and maintaining software, solutions, products and processes under the guidance of a Sr. Engineer, Scrum Master, Project Manager or Manager. Provide IT teams and business personnel with technology solutions by weighing advantages of technology standards, market availability of products, risks and benefits of technology to meet business/IT needs. May assist in the coordination of tasks for subordinates. Independence level: Works under general supervision. The role will be centered on the development and improvement of new and existing features. Additionally, you will participate in peer code reviews, advocate for standard development methodologies, and participate in an inclusive, energetic and highly cross-functional team. The role encompasses design, implementation, and testing to ensure building products right and release them with high quality.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Duties And Accountabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyze, improve, design, develop, test, deploy and maintain both new and existing solutions that meet established business requirements, in accordance with IT development standards. Contribute to project technical architecture design and development. Solutions may include but are not limited to the development of various types of applications, web, mobile app, full stack or integrations hosted on premises data centers or in the cloud. Develop automated Unit tests and/or automated UI tests. (45%) </li><li> Engage with business and IT partners to ensure business needs are satisfied with practical, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. Writes product specifications and design documentation for assigned system components. (25%) </li><li> Collaborate with other project teams or IT partners to coordinate delivery of solutions and minimize technology risk (10%) </li><li> Actively engage with development team lead on progress, status and issues pertaining to assigned deliverables (10%) </li><li> Enhance knowledge of and compliance with preferred technologies, methodologies, standards and policies. Maintain technical knowledge and business acumen within own discipline or function. Strong debugging and problem-solving skills; participate in peer code reviews. (5%) </li><li> Participate in IT architecture review and standards setting. Assist in the development of white papers, conducting presentations as needed to explain why a technology is being recommended by IT. (5%) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>JOB SCOPE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop and maintain deep knowledge of technology and its application across our business areas or for our customers </li><li> Promote knowledge via seminars, presentations and publications within IT and Exelon </li><li> Participate in technological innovation to drive new business opportunities and solve complex business problems </li><li> Requires moderate skill set and proficiency in discipline. </li><li> Conducts work assignments of increasing complexity, under moderate supervision with some latitude for independent judgment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree (ex: Computer Science or related discipline) and 2 - 5 years of relevant experience (programming technologies) or minimum 6 - 9 years of relevant combination of education and work experience </li><li> Demonstrates strong software development capabilities coupled with the ability to work under tight deadlines. </li><li> Demonstrated strong teamwork skills with self-motivation to achieve success in a rapidly evolving environment. </li><li> Excellent communications skills - Able to effectively communicate highly technical information in non-technical terminology (written and verbal). </li><li> Strong knowledge of Operating Systems - Windows, Solaris or Linux </li><li> Programming Languages: Familiar with 1-2 languages/frameworks (e.g. Java, .Net. C#, html, Angular, typescript, etc.) Database: Familiar with Relational </li><li> Databases and understands basic design techniques, ACID properties, and transactions, can write simple, select statements to retrieve information from the database. </li><li> APIs: Able to write code to consume APIs and can create new API based on the design provided by a senior Engineer </li><li> Troubleshooting: Perform basic independent troubleshooting by looking through logs and can investigate and fix simple code issues. May require help to troubleshoot complex issues </li><li> Experience with Agile software development and test-driven development </li><li> Experience in automated testing including unit testing, UI testing and functional testing </li><li> Able to handle more complex software development and support tasks with supervision. </li><li> Able to create good documentation. </li><li> Consistently implements development best practices. </li><li> Develops working relationships with members outside of core team </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prior experience developing software requirements, designing conceptual data models &amp; system architecture, and user interfaces, is a major plus </li><li> Master's degree in CS (or equivalent field) plus 3 years of relevant experiences </li><li> Demonstrated understanding of what makes good software design, a deeper understanding of programming languages, and an ability to solve engineering problems of increasing difficulty. </li><li> Shows initiative beyond pure implementation. </li><li> Experience building highly scalable applications </li><li> Experience working with SCRUM, Kanban or other Agile development environments </li><li> Self-motivated and able to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines </li><li> Energetic </li><li> Works well with team Curious and eager to learn more </li><li>Experience in Documentum solution as preferred skills</li><li>Experience working in Documentum OpenText product version 16.3 and above </li><li>FileNet (IBM),</li><li>Open Text Content Server</li><li>Documentum Administrator</li><li>Documentum Foundation Classes (DFC java),</li><li>Documentum Foundation Services (DFS web services/SOAP),</li><li>Documentum REST API</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-CHICAGO<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-DC-WASHINGTON, US-IL-OAKBROOK TERRACE, US-MD-BALTIMORE, US-PA-PHILADELPHIA, US-Hybrid Remote<p><br></p><strong>Work Locations</strong><p><br></p>2 Lincoln Centre<p><br></p><strong>Job</strong><p><br></p>Information Technology - Staff<p><br></p><strong>Organization</strong><p><br></p>BSC Information Technology<p><br></p><strong>Schedule</strong><p><br></p>Full-time<p><br></p><strong>Employee Status</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Job Posting</strong><p><br></p>Jul 11, 2023, 4:32:40 PM<p><br></p><strong>Unposting Date</strong><p><br></p>Jul 18, 2023, 11:59:00 PM

title: FEA Analyst
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we are passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial's 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The System Verification Test Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will lead software engineering projects directly related to CNH’s precision farming products including auto guidance, telemetry, grade control and section and rate control. The duties include leading a team of test engineers to create test scripts to support the system verification team and leading a team of test engineers to define and execute strategies to increase the amount of automatic testing. Leading and developing test strategies for system testing and performing system test execution for each software release cadence with full verification loops of electronic controllers. Creating and maintaining test reports. Interfacing with the electronic component team to gather hardware specifications of electronic controllers, electronic instrument clusters, displays, telematics and other devices on agricultural and construction equipment. Interfacing with system, software, and functional safety teams to gather requirements of electronic controllers for telematics, displays, auto guidance and other devices. Analyzing and evaluating software and system issues to provide technical analysis reporting, create test reports, evaluate defects and communicate test results to stakeholders, ensuring traceability of test cases, test results, and defects to requirements, and maintaining the HIL (Hardware in the Loop) configuration and bench setup. Salary: $142,600 - $218,500/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Requires a Master’s degree in Software Engineering, or a directly related field plus three years of automated test system development experience. The three years of experience must include three years of experience with each of the following: 1) leading verification activities including software review and analyses, system testing, hardware and software integration and unit testing; 2) identifying and resolving coding, ATE, integration, debugging, and software issues, using MULTI, Code Composer Studio IDE, Trakis Simulator, and Target; 3) working with hardware teams to resolve hardware issues; and 4) developing, implementing, reporting, and analyzing system test procedures using DOORS, Python, and Target Environment, and other applicable programs.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: System Verification Test Engineer
description: <strong>Duration</strong>: 4+ months<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Position Overview:<p><br></p><ul><li>We are seeking a highly skilled Java Production Support Engineer to join our team and provide technical support for our Java-based applications in a production environment. The ideal candidate should have a solid background in Java development and possess strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. As a Production Support Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our applications, resolving issues, and optimizing performance to meet service level agreements (SLAs).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitor and maintain the stability, availability, and performance of Application in a production environment.</li><li>Respond to incidents and service requests, promptly diagnosing and resolving issues to minimize downtime.</li><li>Collaborate with development teams to analyze application logs, troubleshoot problems, and implement effective solutions.</li><li>Perform root cause analysis for recurring issues, identify areas for improvement, and implement preventive measures.</li><li>Conduct performance tuning and optimization activities to enhance application performance and scalability.</li><li>Develop and maintain technical documentation, including standard operating procedures (SOPs), troubleshooting guides, and knowledge base articles.</li><li>Coordinate with stakeholders, including business users, infrastructure teams, and third-party vendors, to ensure seamless operation of the applications.</li><li>Proactively monitor system health, identify potential bottlenecks, and propose and implement proactive measures to improve system reliability.</li><li>Participate in on-call rotations and provide 24/7 support as required.</li><li>Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies related to Java development and production support.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in Java development and production support.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Java programming language and frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot, Microservices).</li><li>Proficiency in troubleshooting Java applications, identifying root causes, and implementing effective solutions.</li><li>Experience with application servers (e.g., Apache Tomcat,WebLogic), web servers (e.g., Apache HTTP Server), and databases (e.g., Oracle, MySQL). </li><li>Experience in cloud technology (Openshift / AWS). Familiarity with Service Now (Incident Management, Problem Management and change management).</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools and technologies (e.g., Splunk, Dyantrace) to proactively identify and resolve issues.</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Git, Docker) for continuous integration and deployment.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail.</li><li>Experience in scripting languages (e.g., Shell scripting, Python) is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

Familiarity with Service Now (Incident Management, Problem Management and change management).</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools and technologies (e.g., Splunk, Dyantrace) to proactively identify and resolve issues.</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Git, Docker) for continuous integration and deployment.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining attention to detail.</li><li>Experience in scripting languages (e.g., Shell scripting, Python) is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: Sharepoint Developer
description: <strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Evaluate, architect, and participate in the implementation of new and existing technologies, services and platforms supporting the corporate technology infrastructure.</li><li>Anticipate and remediate issues, react to problems, and prioritize actions to maintain reliable technology infrastructure operations 24/7/365.</li><li>Ensure high availability of the enterprise technology infrastructure, and assist with capacity planning and risk management activities including evaluating alternatives for resiliency and redundancy, and developing disaster recovery solutions.</li><li>Design and support network and voice-over-IP infrastructure, including wide area and local area networks, MPLS, VPN, firewalls, switches, routers, and associated monitoring tools.</li><li>Perform upgrades and patch management activities on a timely basis for critical technology infrastructure including firewalls, network devices, servers, storage devices, and VMWare.</li><li>Tune and optimize performance, monitor and react to issues with technology assets, including servers and storage, local and wide area network, operating systems and application software.</li><li>Serve as primary point of contact for IT service providers.</li><li>Monitor industry trends, identify opportunities to improve performance, reduce cost, simplify the environment, and/or reduce risk; make recommendations and prepare proposals and plans for implementation.</li><li>Develop and document standards, policies and procedures, and follow best practices for change management to ensure a stable predictable environment.</li><li>Share knowledge and experience with other IT team members, be willing to learn new things.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Professional Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or technology-related degree, or equivalent experience.</li><li>3-5 years of experience configuring, managing, supporting, monitoring, maintaining multi-site enterprise TCP/IP networks, including MPLS, VPN, firewalls, VOIP, and wireless technologies.</li><li>3-5 years of experience administering and supporting VMWare virtualization solutions in an enterprise environment, including vCenter, HA, DRS, scripting and disaster recovery.</li><li>3- 5 years of experience managing infrastructure for Microsoft Windows Server and SUSE Linux.</li><li>3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Windows Server technology including Azure AD, Active Directory, DFS, DHCP, DNS, RDS, GPOs, PowerShell, software deployment tools and security.</li><li>3-5 years of experience with Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS).</li><li>Experience managing data storage environments, including SANs, provisioning LUNS and real time replication.</li><li>Knowledge and understanding of technology infrastructure security concepts, including Azure AD, Web Application Firewalls, penetration testing, vulnerability management, application code scanning, and data loss prevention.</li><li>Experience in a 24/7/365 work schedule environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Personal Attributes</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated efficient and effective use of problem-solving and task prioritization to solve complex challenges and deal with high pressure situations.</li><li>Strong understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.</li><li>Proven project management skills.</li><li>Excellent communication skills and experience effectively communicating with technical and non-technical audiences.</li><li>Highly self-motivated and directed.</li><li>Strong organizational skills.</li><li>Excellent attention to detail.</li><li>Able to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>RTC is an equal-opportunity employer. Women, individuals of all ethnicities, people with disabilities (intellectual and physical), and Veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. We are dedicated to a policy of non-discrimination in employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), age (40 or older), disability or genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, religion or any other basis prohibited by law.</em><p><br></p><strong><u>About RTC</u></strong><p><br></p><em>RTC focuses on continual improvement, evolving our capabilities, and reinvesting in our business to deliver higher-performing solutions for our clients. Brands and retailers require more strategic thinking on the shopper experience, higher levels of innovation, a more effective process for managing customer-specific requirements, access to a broader array of manufactured solutions, and the capability to orchestrate a broader and more complex supply chain. RTC has the integrated capabilities and product development experience to solve these needs and provide you with solutions that help grow your business in retail. </em>Learn more at http://www.rtc.com/.<p><br></p><em>Information about RTC and our benefits are listed here and details about the job opening are below.</em><p><br></p><strong>Why should you consider a career at RTC?</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>401(K) Plan with company match (we also offer a Roth option!</li><li>Hybrid work from home program offered</li><li>Health Insurance through Blue Cross Blue Shield (choose from two PPO plans and one HMO plan based on your deductible comfort level)</li><li>Dental Insurance with two plan options (both PPO Plans)</li><li>Flexible Spending for Health and/or Dependent Care</li><li>Commuter Transit benefit</li><li>Critical illness benefit</li><li>Life Insurance (we cover 3 times your salary - you can purchase more)</li><li>Short-Term Disability Coverage (we'll cover this for you too - you can choose to purchase long-term disability)</li><li>2 weeks of paid Parental Leave</li><li>16 PTO Days (full year)</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Tuition Assistance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Perks</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Fun Friday Hours - get a head start on your weekend by leaving at 2:30 every Friday (year-round!)</li><li>Volunteer Time Off (VTO) plus company-sponsored volunteer events.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Wellness</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>PTO is encouraged not only for vacations but mental health breaks.</li><li>Work/Life resources such as Legal, Financial, and Counseling are available through our Employee Assistance Program.</li><li>Discounts to eligible fitness centers for associates enrolled with Blue Cross.</li><li>Preventative Care is covered at 100% (annual check-ups and screenings).</li><li>Lactation rooms are available for new mothers at Rolling Meadows location.</li><li>Annual flu clinic at Romeoville and Rolling Meadows for our associates and any dependents covered on our health plan. Flu shots are covered by insurance if associate elects to go elsewhere.</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Career Development &amp; Training </strong></em><p><br></p>We encourage your professional growth and development. We offer mentors with deep industry experience, and management who will assist you in defining and realizing your short and long term career goals and a variety of opportunities for training and advancement.

title: Java Production Support Engineer (contract)
description: The Systems Assessment Center within the Energy Systems and Infrastructure Analysis Division at Argonne National Laboratory develops and maintains the Greenhouse gases, Regulated Emissions, and Energy use in Technologies (GREET®) model which is widely used by government, industry, and academic stakeholders to provide objective and transparent life cycle energy use and emissions (see https://greet.anl.gov). We are seeking qualified applicants for a software developer position to develop a new generation of the GREET life cycle analysis (LCA) model and web-based applications for a broad user base of the GREET model and derivative modules and tools. To be successful in this role, the candidate should have extensive knowledge and experience of Python programming language and software development, including building application programming interfaces (APIs), integrations using modular architecture, and interactions with user interfaces (UI).<p><br></p>The Systems Assessment Center continues a 30-year history of leadership in the field of life cycle analysis. The software developer will work with the GREET research team to design modeling architecture and develop source codes for key GREET modeling functionalities, establish data structure for the extensive GREET database, and implement new web-based interfaces and modules. Working with an internal and external team on the new GREET software development, the successful candidate will coordinate team efforts and ensure completion and release of the software on schedule.<p><br></p>In this position, the successful candidate will:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work closely with the GREET life cycle analysis research team to understand software requirement for the next generation GREET software.</li><li>Develop the new GREET software with a modular software architecture.</li><li>Apply Python and preferably JavaScript as the programing languages for backend and frontend development of the GREET software.</li><li>Design APIs to support both a standalone and server/web-based applications of the GREET software.</li><li>Test and debug all the model functionalities of the newly developed GREET software.</li><li>Work with unstructured databases such as XML/JSON to transfer existing databases to the new GREET software.</li><li>Lead the maintenance, expansion, and upgrade of the new GREET software after its initial public release.</li><li>Use version control tools to track and document the development progress.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s and 5+ years, or Master’s and 3+ years, or Doctorate and 0 years.</li><li>Experience in developing software development using Python and preferably JavaScript.</li><li>Ability to communicate with GREET LCA team effectively about requirements, features, and functionalities of the new GREET software.</li><li>Experience with a range of programming languages and associated libraries, including: General-purpose programming (C#, Python, and Java). Version control and automation tools (e.g., Git).</li><li>Efficient project management practices and the ability to deliver project milestones on schedule.</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred qualifications include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Follow UI/UX best practices to develop external-facing, web-based interfaces and applications that pivot to Argonne’s GREET suite of models to support online, simplified, and intuitive simulation experiences of users.</li><li>Experience with web-related programming (HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and JQuery).</li><li>Experience with cloud-computing services (Oracle Cloud, AWS, Azure).</li><li>Demonstrated experience and capabilities in both backend programing and frontend web-based user interface development.</li><li>Basic engineering knowledge.</li><li>Understanding of life cycle analysis of technologies.</li><li>Passion for data-driven policy decisions for societal sustainability.</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested candidates should provide a curriculum vitae, sample software and/or web applications, and names and contact information for three professional references to the application management system.<p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Research Development (RD)<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Software Engineering 2<p><br></p><strong>Worker Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Time Type</strong><p><br></p>Full time<p><br></p><em>As an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer, and in accordance with our core values of impact, safety, respect, integrity and teamwork, Argonne National Laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters collaborative scientific discovery and innovation. In support of this commitment, Argonne encourages minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment. Argonne considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p><em>Argonne employees, and certain guest researchers and contractors, are subject to particular restrictions related to participation in Foreign Government Sponsored or Affiliated Activities, as defined and detailed in United States Department of Energy Order 486.1A. You will be asked to disclose any such participation in the application phase for review by Argonne's Legal Department. </em><p><br></p><em>All Argonne offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes an assessment of criminal conviction history conducted on an individualized and case-by-case basis. Please be advised that Argonne positions require upon hire (or may require in the future) for the individual be to obtain a government access authorization that involves additional background check requirements. Failure to obtain or maintain such government access authorization could result in the withdrawal of a job offer or future termination of employment.</em>
