title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <span><span><strong>Job Description:<br>  <br>  Pay Range $60.28hr - $64.28hr<br>  <br>  Responsibilities:</strong></span>  </span>  <ul>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Own the Software QA process, including developing, implementing, and maintaining test plans, test scenarios, and test cases.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Analyze requirements and design specifications for test case development.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Recommend test automation approach, tools, and frameworks.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Develop test infrastructure and custom automation tools as needed to expand test coverage and enable non-functional testing.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Perform manual and automated tests for our website and applications.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Prioritize test execution.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Find and report defects with detailed, accurate, and concise steps to reproduce.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Assist developers in discovering and researching defects, and recommend system enhancements.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Complete ownership for all testing across multiple applications built with a varied set of tools/technologies.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Hands-on testing that includes analyzing requirements, preparing test plans, and building appropriate test cases to validate the functionality being built.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Support and execution of the application testing phase (functional &amp; non-functional) to ensure all software meets requirements before changes are placed in production.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Liaison/co-ordination with other technology groups (across sites) to coordinate/execute end-end testing.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Drive all efforts on test automation, including planning, hands-on scripting, and oversight of other resources working on automation.</span>  </span>  </li>  </ul>  <span>  <span>  <strong>  Requirements:</strong></span>  </span>  <ul>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience breaking complex software systems.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience evaluating software architectures and designs to identify potential quality, performance, and scalability weaknesses or limitations and developing an automated test regimen to fully exercise these suspect areas.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience leading QA process development, execution, and documentation.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  A strong command of manual and automated testing methodologies and general quality concepts.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with Agile and Scrum.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with scripting software automation testing products, including Selenium and Cucumber.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with Automation Framework Development using Selenium and Java.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience in TDD, BDD, and ATDD.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience in Mobile Automation Testing tools.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with LoadRunner/JMeter load testing.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Extensive knowledge of web technologies and experience testing web APIs/REST services.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience of automating complex systems integration (End-To-End).</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience integrating the execution of Selenium regression scripts with Continuous Integration build servers like Jenkins.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience testing hosted/cloud SaaS web applications is highly desirable.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience in Mobile Automation testing and tools.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience testing native mobile applications is desirable.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Bachelors in Computer Science, or related field or equivalent experience.</span></span></li></ul>

website and applications.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Prioritize test execution.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Find and report defects with detailed, accurate, and concise steps to reproduce.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Assist developers in discovering and researching defects, and recommend system enhancements.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Complete ownership for all testing across multiple applications built with a varied set of tools/technologies.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Hands-on testing that includes analyzing requirements, preparing test plans, and building appropriate test cases to validate the functionality being built.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Support and execution of the application testing phase (functional &amp; non-functional) to ensure all software meets requirements before changes are placed in production.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Liaison/co-ordination with other technology groups (across sites) to coordinate/execute end-end testing.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Drive all efforts on test automation, including planning, hands-on scripting, and oversight of other resources working on automation.</span>  </span>  </li>  </ul>  <span>  <span>  <strong>  Requirements:</strong></span>  </span>  <ul>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience breaking complex software systems.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience evaluating software architectures and designs to identify potential quality, performance, and scalability weaknesses or limitations and developing an automated test regimen to fully exercise these suspect areas.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience leading QA process development, execution, and documentation.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  A strong command of manual and automated testing methodologies and general quality concepts.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with Agile and Scrum.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with scripting software automation testing products, including Selenium and Cucumber.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with Automation Framework Development using Selenium and Java.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience in TDD, BDD, and ATDD.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience in Mobile Automation Testing tools.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience with LoadRunner/JMeter load testing.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Extensive knowledge of web technologies and experience testing web APIs/REST services.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience of automating complex systems integration (End-To-End).</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience integrating the execution of Selenium regression scripts with Continuous Integration build servers like Jenkins.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience testing hosted/cloud SaaS web applications is highly desirable.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience in Mobile Automation testing and tools.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Experience testing native mobile applications is desirable.</span>  </span>  </li>  <li>  <span>  <span>  Bachelors in Computer Science, or related field or equivalent experience.</span></span></li></ul>

title: Software Developer
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company. Driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground, which centers on Innovation, Sustainability and Productivity, the Company provides the strategic direction, R&amp;D capabilities, and investments that enable the success of its five core Brands: Case IH, New Holland Agriculture and STEYR, supplying 360° agriculture applications from machines to implements and the digital technologies that enhance them; and CASE and New Holland Construction Equipment delivering a full lineup of construction products that make the industry more productive. Across a history spanning over two centuries, CNH Industrial has always been a pioneer in its sectors and continues to passionately innovate and drive customer efficiency and success, driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 35,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Duties: The System Verification Test Engineer at CNH Industrial America LLC in Burr Ridge, Illinois will be responsible for ensuring the overall form, fit, and function of new or current products when integrated into a single, complete system including vehicle displays, application controls, steering solutions, digital services and telematics, to fully autonomous driverless technology. This position will develop test strategies for system testing; perform system test execution for each software release cadence with full verification loops of electronic controllers and create and maintain the test reports; interface with the electronic component team to gather hardware specifications of electronic controllers, electronic instrument clusters, displays, telematics and other devices on agricultural and construction equipment; interface with system, software, and Functional Safety teams to gather requirements of electronic controllers for telematics, displays, auto guidance and other devices; develop robust, flexible, and re-usable test scripting for automated testing; create test reports, defects and communicate test results to stakeholders; ensure traceability of test cases, test results, and defects to requirements; maintain the HIL (Hardware-in-the-loop) configuration and bench setup; support application and system engineering teams with preparation of reports; support Design of Experiments and Design Validation testing; and identify and implement new procedures for process improvements. May telecommute two days per week. Salary: $109,410 - $163,300/year.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Electronic Engineering or a related field and five years of experience working with embedded software development or automated test system development. The five years of experience must include five years of experience with each of the following: (1) electronic controller design, including software architecture, electrical circuits, and I/O circuitry for electronic control; (2) software integration testing and module testing; (3) supporting the design of experiments and design validation testing; and (4) HIL equipment including DSPACE or National Instruments.<p><br></p>CNH Industrial America LLC' s ongoing employee referral program does apply to this position.<p><br></p>Interested candidates should apply online at http://cnhindustrial.com/<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventative care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description: <p>Client - World's leading global foodservice retailer.</p><p><br></p><p>We are looking for skilled DevOps Engineer to help own the transformation and ongoing standardization of CI/CD pipelines and test and development environments.</p><p><br></p><p>Develop and drive CI/CD tool adoption and standardization, and development environment improvements.</p><p><br></p><p>Using CI/CD optimizations, cloud environments, and standardization technology to improve the development lifecycle and code quality.</p><p><br></p><p>Responsibilities</p><p>Evaluating the CI/CD pipeline and the development environments.</p><p>to improve scalability and leverage automation.</p><p>to resolve repetitive issues in the CI/CD pipeline and development environments.</p><p>Work in an agile, startup-like development environment</p><p><br></p><p>Qualifications</p><p>specialization in DevOps areas of focus.</p><p>Excellent coding and scripting skills (Bash, Groovy) and experience with implementing high-scale cloud architectures using modern, cloud-based container platforms (PaaS/SaaS)</p><p>Solid understanding of deployment automation solutions (i.e. Puppet, Chef, Ansible)</p><p>Solid, applied, knowledge of cloud infrastructure and cluster management tools like Kubernetes (AWS EKS)</p><p>Experience with containers such as Docker</p><p>Experience with continuous integration and related tools such as Jenkins Pipelines, GitHub Actions, SonarQube, etc.</p><p>Implement capacity management as business practice for release environment management team working with other middleware and infrastructure teams.</p><p>Develop recommendations for improvements and strives to automate manual processes for existing tools and operations.</p><p>Collaborate with Test Automation, CICD teams to improve automation capabilities.</p><p>Perform root-cause analysis of defects to identify and implement solutions and process improvements.</p><p>Experience with writing Terraform scripts</p><p>Experience with implementing Service Mesh with Istio</p><p>Experience working with API Gateway</p>

title: System Verification Test Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Join one of the nation’s most comprehensive academic medical centers, <strong>UChicago Medicine</strong>, as a <strong>Citrix Engineer - Intermediate </strong>for our <strong>Information Systems</strong> division. <strong>This is a remote, work from home opportunity and you may be based outside of the greater Chicagoland area.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>The <strong>Citrix Engineer - Intermediate</strong> helps administer day-to-day operations of key system environment(s). Assists in the design, administration, analysis, evaluation, troubleshooting, and documenting of complex existing technology systems (e.g., technical platforms, such as the Citrix systems, Xenapp, Storefront, and PVS environments, etc.). Assists with more complex testing and analysis of all elements of the systems’ capabilities. Understands the business impact of events and decisions made relating to system changes/enhancements. Helps make decisions and determine policy to maximize system availability.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Job Functions<br><br></u></strong>Citrix Systems Administration:<br><ul><li> Responsible for all activities related to Citrix system administration including: Xenapp 7.15 for 10,000+ customers, Storefront 7.15, Netscaler, Provisioning Services (PVS), User Profile Management (UPM) for 18,000+ customers, RemotePC Upgrades, migrations, and patching to all Citrix hosts in dev/test/prd/dr environments. </li><li> Citrix support tickets from customers via service now. </li><li> Application updates in Citrix for MS Office, clinical applications, Epic Hyperspace/Hyperdrive. </li><li> Analyzes causes of issues, or problems and takes necessary corrective action. </li><li> Ensures long-term requirements of systems operations and administration are included in the overall information systems planning of the organization. </li><li> Maintains and upgrades hardware and software including technical architecture related to hardware and basic network connectivity. </li><li> Monitors and maintains continuity with system software licensing and maintenance agreements. </li><li> Implements system enhancements that will improve the reliability and performance of the systems. </li><li> Establishes/recommends policies on system use and services. </li><li> Responsible for design, support and implementation of Disaster Recovery and High Availability plans. </li><li> Acts as resource for other System Engineers and mentors less experienced System Engineers. </li><li> Has responsibility for purchase justification. </li><li> Stays current with system technology and trends. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Windows Administration<br></u></strong><ul><li> The System Engineer sets up and maintains all Windows enterprise systems within the enterprise. Specific tasks include setup and maintenance of new systems, implementing network connectivity, performing routine backups, performing system recovery when there are problems, securing systems against unauthorized access from entities both from within and without the University, understanding the needs of the enterprise, recommending specific solutions, and in developing long range strategies to accommodate the continued growth of the department. </li><li> The SE will coordinate and perform the installation, maintenance, and replacement of all parts as appropriate for server environments within the organization, as per service contracts with vendors and customers alike. </li><li> Engage technical support personnel when appropriate. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Technical Project Coordination<br></u></strong><ul><li> As a key resource within the enterprise, the systems engineer will provide project coordination and lead technical expertise for information technology initiatives. </li><li> The systems engineer will be expected to provide assistance to the Manager in ongoing project audit and task review. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Escalation Point For Support Requests<br></u></strong><ul><li> The systems engineer is a 3rd tier support resource for any and all technical support requests generated within the division. The requests may range from independent desktop issues to complex server or network failures. </li><li> In the event of a support issue that requires interaction with non-Information Services support entities, the systems engineer is expected to coordinate resources, and act as the primary focal point for the customer during the problem resolution process. </li><li> The systems engineer is expected to take a leadership role in resolution of complex problems. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Relationships<br></u></strong><ul><li> The systems engineer works with other IS groups within the organization, and with NSIT network and system engineers. </li><li> The systems engineer will need to work closely with the systems engineers within the organization in the support of the infrastructure of the enterprise, and in the design and development of cross-platform systems and processes to increase efficiency and reduce the overhead involved in supporting the enterprise throughout the Medical Center departments and the Division. <br></li></ul><strong><u>New Technology Evaluation<br></u></strong><ul><li> As directed by the Manager, the systems engineer will perform feasibility review and testing of new hardware and software technologies, and provide detailed feedback regarding that review, to intermediate management, and any other appropriate personnel. </li><li> Furthermore, systems engineer is expected to provide ongoing guidance to other SE's who are involved in new technology evaluation projects. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Professional Development<br></u></strong><ul><li> Attend appropriate training and professional development conferences to ensure that the Systems Administrator skill set continues to meet customer demands. </li><li> Performs other duties assigned. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> BS or BA degree, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent education, training or work experience </li><li> Five or more years Programming or System Administration experience </li><li> Skilled and experienced with any or all of the following hardware: HPE and/or UCS blades systems, VMware and Windows Operating systems </li><li> Detailed understanding of networking/distributed computing environment concepts </li><li> Understanding of Volume and Data administration not limited to stripping, concatenation and RAID concepts </li><li> Detailed understanding of performance and tuning not limited to memory and storage </li><li> Independent problem-solver. Sorts through issues and conducts comparative analysis of multiple solutions (i.e., skilled in problem analysis; pays very close attention to detail) </li><li> Able to work in a team environment or independently </li><li> Excellent listening and organizational skills with emphasis on detail and follow-through </li><li> Able to organize and delegate tasks, coordinate projects and be willing to advise others </li><li> Skilled in project management and work plan development and implementation </li><li> Effective oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills </li><li> Project Leader training preferred </li><li> Advance degree (Masters) preferred <br></li></ul><strong><u>Citrix Administration<br><br></u></strong>Experience with the following required:<br><ul><li> Detailed understanding of XenApp 7.15 for 10,000+ customers, Storefront 7.15, Netscaler, Provisioning Services (PVS), User Profile Management (UPM) for 18,000+ customers, RemotePC </li><li> Upgrades, migrations, and patching to all Citrix hosts in dev/test/prd/dr environments </li><li> Citrix support tickets from customers via service now </li><li> Application updates in Citrix for MS Office, clinical applications, Epic Hyperspace/Hyperdrive <br></li></ul><strong><u>Windows Administration<br></u></strong><ul><li> Skilled and experienced with Windows of some variety: Windows 2012/2016/2019 server OS </li><li> High skill with most of Windows 2012/2016/2019 Server and Workstation commands/utilities. </li><li> Familiarity with most basic system administration tools and processes. </li><li> Ability to write and understand scripts in some administrative language (Powershell) <br></li></ul><strong> Position Details <br></strong><ul><li> Job Type/FTE: Full-Time </li><li> Shift: Day </li><li> Unit/Department: IT Technology Services </li><li> CBA Code: Non-Union <br></li></ul>Must comply with UCMC’s COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire.<br><br><strong> Why Join Us <br><br></strong>We’ve been at the forefront of medicine since 1899. We provide superior healthcare with compassion, always mindful that each patient is a person, an individual. To accomplish this, we need employees with passion, talent and commitment… with patients and with each other. We’re in this together: working to advance medical innovation, serve the health needs of the community, and move our collective knowledge forward. If you’d like to add enriching human life to your profile, The University of Chicago Medicine is for you. Here at the forefront, we’re doing work that really matters. Join us. Bring your passion.<br><br>________<br><br>Bring your career to the next level at a hospital that is thriving; from patient satisfaction to employee engagement, we are at the Forefront of Medicine. Take advantage of all we have to offer and #BringYourPassiontotheForefront.<br><br>University of Chicago Medicine is growing; discover how you can be a part of this pursuit of excellence at: www.uchospitals.edu/jobs<br><br>The University of Chicago Medical Center is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, civil union status, parental status, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status and other legally protected characteristics.

Sorts through issues and conducts comparative analysis of multiple solutions (i.e., skilled in problem analysis; pays very close attention to detail) </li><li> Able to work in a team environment or independently </li><li> Excellent listening and organizational skills with emphasis on detail and follow-through </li><li> Able to organize and delegate tasks, coordinate projects and be willing to advise others </li><li> Skilled in project management and work plan development and implementation </li><li> Effective oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills </li><li> Project Leader training preferred </li><li> Advance degree (Masters) preferred <br></li></ul><strong><u>Citrix Administration<br><br></u></strong>Experience with the following required:<br><ul><li> Detailed understanding of XenApp 7.15 for 10,000+ customers, Storefront 7.15, Netscaler, Provisioning Services (PVS), User Profile Management (UPM) for 18,000+ customers, RemotePC </li><li> Upgrades, migrations, and patching to all Citrix hosts in dev/test/prd/dr environments </li><li> Citrix support tickets from customers via service now </li><li> Application updates in Citrix for MS Office, clinical applications, Epic Hyperspace/Hyperdrive <br></li></ul><strong><u>Windows Administration<br></u></strong><ul><li> Skilled and experienced with Windows of some variety: Windows 2012/2016/2019 server OS </li><li> High skill with most of Windows 2012/2016/2019 Server and Workstation commands/utilities. </li><li> Familiarity with most basic system administration tools and processes. </li><li> Ability to write and understand scripts in some administrative language (Powershell) <br></li></ul><strong> Position Details <br></strong><ul><li> Job Type/FTE: Full-Time </li><li> Shift: Day </li><li> Unit/Department: IT Technology Services </li><li> CBA Code: Non-Union <br></li></ul>Must comply with UCMC’s COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire.<br><br><strong> Why Join Us <br><br></strong>We’ve been at the forefront of medicine since 1899. We provide superior healthcare with compassion, always mindful that each patient is a person, an individual. To accomplish this, we need employees with passion, talent and commitment… with patients and with each other. We’re in this together: working to advance medical innovation, serve the health needs of the community, and move our collective knowledge forward. If you’d like to add enriching human life to your profile, The University of Chicago Medicine is for you. Here at the forefront, we’re doing work that really matters. Join us. Bring your passion.<br><br>________<br><br>Bring your career to the next level at a hospital that is thriving; from patient satisfaction to employee engagement, we are at the Forefront of Medicine. Take advantage of all we have to offer and #BringYourPassiontotheForefront.<br><br>University of Chicago Medicine is growing; discover how you can be a part of this pursuit of excellence at: www.uchospitals.edu/jobs<br><br>The University of Chicago Medical Center is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, civil union status, parental status, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status and other legally protected characteristics.

title: DevOps Engineer
description: Growing engineering team is seeking an FEA Analyst to create system and subsystem models and simulations to optimize product development. We need an engineer to develop large models of complex systems from concept through bench testing. We need an Engineer to develop analytical methods to advanced tools for optimal product design, finite element analysis, and development.<p><br></p>If you are seeking a fantastic team just north of Chicago, IL, please read on!<p><br></p><strong>WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING - Model FEA Analyst!</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Finite Element Analysis</li><li>Define simulation, generate statements of work, and define timelines</li><li>Research all relevant marketing specifications</li><li>Develop large models of complex systems involving multiple physics</li><li>Participate in Design reviews</li></ul><strong>WHAT YOU NEED - Modeling and Simulation Engineer</strong><strong>: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Masters</li><li>FEA</li><li>5+ years of System modeling </li><li>Experience with the design, analysis and testing of systems and sub-systems</li><li>Familiar with data acquisition systems</li><li>Experience with troubleshooting and Root Cause Analysis for electro-mechanical equipment</li><li>Continuous improvement mindset</li></ul><strong>WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU - FEA Analyst!</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary</li><li>Comprehensive benefits</li><li>Amazing work environment</li><li>Fun and exciting projects</li><li>Much more!</li></ul>So, if you are an FEA Analyst, apply today!

title: Citrix Engineer - Intermediate - Full Time Remote
description: We're powering a cleaner, brighter future.<p><br></p>Exelon is leading the energy transformation, and we're calling all problem solvers, innovators, community builders and change makers. Work with us to deliver solutions that make our diverse cities and communities stronger, healthier and more resilient.<p><br></p>We're powered by purpose-driven people like you who believe in being inclusive and creative, and value safety, innovation, integrity and community service. We are a Fortune 200 company, 19,000 colleagues strong serving more than 10 million customers at six energy companies -- Atlantic City Electric (ACE), Baltimore Gas and Electric (BGE), Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), Delmarva Power &amp; Light (DPL), PECO Energy Company (PECO), and Potomac Electric Power Company (Pepco).<p><br></p>In our relentless pursuit of excellence, we elevate diverse voices, fresh perspectives and bold thinking. And since we know transforming the future of energy is hard work, we provide competitive compensation, incentives, excellent benefits and the opportunity to build a rewarding career.<p><br></p>Are you in?<p><br></p><ul><li>Position may be required to work extended hours, including 24 x 7 coverage during storms or other energy delivery emergencies.</li></ul><p><br></p>Note: This is a flex position meaning this role will be part remote and part in the office.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Purpose Of Position</u></strong><p><br></p>Perform activities relating to designing, building, testing, implementing and maintaining software, solutions, products and processes under the guidance of a Sr. Engineer, Scrum Master, Project Manager or Manager. Provide IT teams and business personnel with technology solutions by weighing advantages of technology standards, market availability of products, risks and benefits of technology to meet business/IT needs. May assist in the coordination of tasks for subordinates. Independence level: Works under general supervision. The role will be centered on the development and improvement of new and existing features. Additionally, you will participate in peer code reviews, advocate for standard development methodologies, and participate in an inclusive, energetic and highly cross-functional team. The role encompasses design, implementation, and testing to ensure building products right and release them with high quality.<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Duties And Accountabilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyze, improve, design, develop, test, deploy and maintain both new and existing solutions that meet established business requirements, in accordance with IT development standards. Contribute to project technical architecture design and development. Solutions may include but are not limited to the development of various types of applications, web, mobile app, full stack or integrations hosted on premises data centers or in the cloud. Develop automated Unit tests and/or automated UI tests. (45%) </li><li> Engage with business and IT partners to ensure business needs are satisfied with practical, efficient, and cost-effective solutions. Writes product specifications and design documentation for assigned system components. (25%) </li><li> Collaborate with other project teams or IT partners to coordinate delivery of solutions and minimize technology risk (10%) </li><li> Actively engage with development team lead on progress, status and issues pertaining to assigned deliverables (10%) </li><li> Enhance knowledge of and compliance with preferred technologies, methodologies, standards and policies. Maintain technical knowledge and business acumen within own discipline or function. Strong debugging and problem-solving skills; participate in peer code reviews. (5%) </li><li> Participate in IT architecture review and standards setting. Assist in the development of white papers, conducting presentations as needed to explain why a technology is being recommended by IT. (5%) </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>JOB SCOPE</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop and maintain deep knowledge of technology and its application across our business areas or for our customers </li><li> Promote knowledge via seminars, presentations and publications within IT and Exelon </li><li> Participate in technological innovation to drive new business opportunities and solve complex business problems </li><li> Requires moderate skill set and proficiency in discipline. </li><li> Conducts work assignments of increasing complexity, under moderate supervision with some latitude for independent judgment. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree (ex: Computer Science or related discipline) and 2 - 5 years of relevant experience (programming technologies) or minimum 6 - 9 years of relevant combination of education and work experience </li><li> Demonstrates strong software development capabilities coupled with the ability to work under tight deadlines. </li><li> Demonstrated strong teamwork skills with self-motivation to achieve success in a rapidly evolving environment. </li><li> Excellent communications skills - Able to effectively communicate highly technical information in non-technical terminology (written and verbal). </li><li> Strong knowledge of Operating Systems - Windows, Solaris or Linux </li><li> Programming Languages: Familiar with 1-2 languages/frameworks (e.g. Java, .Net. C#, html, Angular, typescript, etc.) Database: Familiar with Relational </li><li> Databases and understands basic design techniques, ACID properties, and transactions, can write simple, select statements to retrieve information from the database. </li><li> APIs: Able to write code to consume APIs and can create new API based on the design provided by a senior Engineer </li><li> Troubleshooting: Perform basic independent troubleshooting by looking through logs and can investigate and fix simple code issues. May require help to troubleshoot complex issues </li><li> Experience with Agile software development and test-driven development </li><li> Experience in automated testing including unit testing, UI testing and functional testing </li><li> Able to handle more complex software development and support tasks with supervision. </li><li> Able to create good documentation. </li><li> Consistently implements development best practices. </li><li> Develops working relationships with members outside of core team </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Prior experience developing software requirements, designing conceptual data models &amp; system architecture, and user interfaces, is a major plus </li><li> Master's degree in CS (or equivalent field) plus 3 years of relevant experiences </li><li> Demonstrated understanding of what makes good software design, a deeper understanding of programming languages, and an ability to solve engineering problems of increasing difficulty. </li><li> Shows initiative beyond pure implementation. </li><li> Experience building highly scalable applications </li><li> Experience working with SCRUM, Kanban or other Agile development environments </li><li> Self-motivated and able to prioritize and manage workload and meet critical project milestones and deadlines </li><li> Energetic </li><li> Works well with team Curious and eager to learn more </li><li>Experience in Documentum solution as preferred skills</li><li>Experience working in Documentum OpenText product version 16.3 and above </li><li>FileNet (IBM),</li><li>Open Text Content Server</li><li>Documentum Administrator</li><li>Documentum Foundation Classes (DFC java),</li><li>Documentum Foundation Services (DFS web services/SOAP),</li><li>Documentum REST API</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Primary Location</strong><p><br></p>US-IL-CHICAGO<p><br></p><strong>Other Locations</strong><p><br></p>US-DC-WASHINGTON, US-IL-OAKBROOK TERRACE, US-MD-BALTIMORE, US-PA-PHILADELPHIA, US-Hybrid Remote<p><br></p><strong>Work Locations</strong><p><br></p>2 Lincoln Centre<p><br></p><strong>Job</strong><p><br></p>Information Technology - Staff<p><br></p><strong>Organization</strong><p><br></p>BSC Information Technology<p><br></p><strong>Schedule</strong><p><br></p>Full-time<p><br></p><strong>Employee Status</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Job Posting</strong><p><br></p>Jul 11, 2023, 4:32:40 PM<p><br></p><strong>Unposting Date</strong><p><br></p>Jul 18, 2023, 11:59:00 PM

title: FEA Analyst
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>Since 1922, Shorr has been providing its customers with products and services designed to deliver the best packaging solutions with an ongoing focus on innovation and progress. Steeped in the tradition of a family business Shorr proudly offers its customers a unique combination of in-depth business knowledge and personal service and our employee’s ownership in our success. Shorr Packaging has experienced significant growth year over year. Our growth can be directly tied to our culture of employee ownership and unparalleled customer service and support.<br><br>As an employee-owned company since 1984, every member of the Shorr Packaging team is committed to the company's success. Today, Shorr has employee owners in branch locations across the U.S. and represents premier manufacturers like 3M, Pregis, and Lantech.<br><br>The solution to our success is our people, both our customers and our employee owners.<br><br>This position is a hybrid role relying on the candidate to act as both architect and developer. This position is responsible f or guiding the direction and approach for architecture within the Shorr Salesforce environment while also being hands on and developing when necessary.<br><br>The ideal candidate is positive, solution-oriented, understands Salesforce features and functionality, and is focused on data governance, process, and best practices. Additionally, this candidate will be viewed as a leader, influencer and must possess very strong communication skills.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Develop a technical vision and roadmap to match overall company Salesforce strategy and vision </li><li> Present architecture options and recommendations following best practices ensuring an optimized, secure, and scalable system </li><li> Guide the direction, quality, and approach for architecture of Salesforce across Shorr with clear deliverables like architecture diagrams and documentation </li><li> Use your Salesforce technical development expertise to design and develop solutions for new strategic projects while also supporting incoming production requests </li><li> Educate and demonstrate to the business and IT organizations Salesforce capabilities and integration points, understand their challenges and develop automated solutions </li><li> Review the existing systems landscape and provide guidance on optimization and automation while balancing the need for custom code and configuration </li><li> Monitor the platform, ensure that all flows are documented, evaluate new functionalities, suggest and lead process improvement initiatives addressing gaps across all three pillars: business processes, people knowledge and system enhancements </li><li> Discover processes that can be automated to simplify the user experience for our end-users and customers, then design and execute elegant solutions </li><li> Manage environments, deployments, data cleansing, package installations &amp; data import tasks <br><br></li></ul>Qualifications:<br><ul><li>7+ years of established leadership experience in Salesforce delivery</li><li>Able to work in a fast-paced environment, multi-task, prioritize multiple projects, and be a proactive problem solver</li><li>Able to lead and drive complex operational initiatives and can demonstrate an ability to create clarity for their team</li><li>Track record of Salesforce.com experience as a developer with extensive knowledge of Sales, Service, Marketing, and Commerce Clouds; SOQL, Apex, VisualForce, Lightning Web Components, and Force.com tools and applications, preferably in an instance with 500+ end-users</li><li>Experience with Order Management, Revenue Cloud, and/or ServiceMax are a plus</li><li>High level knowledge with Boomi a plus<br><br></li></ul> Shorr Packaging Corp. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Female/Male/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity) that provides our employee owners with excellent compensation and benefits including 401K, employee stock (ESOP), medical, dental, life, and more.

title: Software Engineer (L2) - Hybrid/Flex
description: <u>Department</u><p><br></p>BSD CTD - Engineering: Plan X - QA<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The Center for Translational Data Science (CTDS) at the University of Chicago is a research center whose mission is to develop the discipline of translational data science to impactful problems in biology, medicine, healthcare, and the environment. We envision a world in which researchers have ready access to the data needed and the tools required to make data driven discoveries that increase our scientific knowledge and improve the quality of life. We architect ecosystems of large-scale commons of research data, computing resources, applications, tools, and services for the broader research community to use data at scale to pursue scientific inquiry and accelerate discovery. Learn more at https://gdc.cancer.gov/ , https://gen3.org/ , https://stats.gen3.org/ , and https://ctds.uchicago.edu/. This at-will position is wholly or partially funded by contractual grant funding which is renewed under provisions set by the grantor of the contract. Employment will be contingent upon the continued receipt of these grant funds and satisfactory job performance.<p><br></p><u><strong>Job Information</strong></u><p><br></p>Software Engineers in Test for various &amp; unanticipated worksites throughout the U.S. (HQ: Chicago, IL). Work with cloud computing infrastructure primarily based on OpenStack to architect and implement quality assurance practices across all phases of the testing lifecycle. Coding includes the full stack including systems orchestration, API development, algorithms and data structures, and user interfaces. Projects span management, sharing, and provenance of large data sets, automation, metrics, and scheduling for cloud computing, large scale pipe lining of next-generation sequence analysis, transfer programs/protocols for high-speed networks and resource visualization. Responsible for creating the project Software Quality Assurance Plan. Create and implement QA Test Plans and SOPs Test functionalities prior to each release on each tier (QA, Stage and Production). Design and evaluate tests. Test the product to be compliant with technical specifications and policy requirements, including unit testing, automated regression testing. Identify necessary teams to successfully complete the Test Phase Contribute to Master Test Plan and Strategy by identifying appropriate test techniques and tools that ensure product quality and test completion. Develop the test case documents according to the Master Test Plan/Test Strategy. Facilitate triage of defects and assist in defect investigation and escalation. Walk through the test results with the team and communicate status to management and project leadership. Assist with the implementation of automated testing tools. Serves as a liaison with internal and external collaborators on various research projects. Technical Environment: Openstack (GDC); Unix/Linux; Python; JavaScript; Go; Kubernetes; Docker; version control.<p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u>Additional Requirements</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Information Systems or related field plus 2 years of experience in the job offered, as a QA Engineer or in software QA/Testing required. Required Skills: all phases of the test lifecycle; design and evaluate tests; test case development, automated regression testing; Unix/Linux; Python; JavaScript; Kubernetes; Docker; version control. Background check including review of conviction history required. May work remote. (*Masters degree in Information Systems or related field plus 1 year of experience in the job offered, as a QA Engineer or in software QA/Testing also acceptable).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Schedule</strong>: Full time<p><br></p><strong>Application Information</strong><p><br></p><em>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.</em><p><br></p>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<p><br></p><u>Benefit Eligibility</u><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong><u>Requires Compliance with University Covid-19 Vaccination Requirement</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Pay Frequency</u><p><br></p>Monthly<p><br></p><u>Pay Range</u><p><br></p><strong><u>Depends On Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><u>Scheduled Weekly Hours</u><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><u>Union</u><p><br></p>Non-Union<p><br></p><u>Job is Exempt</u><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><u>Drug Test Required</u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Health Screen Required</u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Posting Date</u><p><br></p>2023-07-11<p><br></p><u>Remove from Posting On or Before</u><p><br></p>2024-01-11<p><br></p><strong><u>Posting Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<p><br></p>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<p><br></p>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<p><br></p>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.
description_json: <u>Department</u><p><br></p>BSD CTD - Engineering: Plan X - QA<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Department</u></strong><p><br></p>The Center for Translational Data Science (CTDS) at the University of Chicago is a research center whose mission is to develop the discipline of translational data science to impactful problems in biology, medicine, healthcare, and the environment. We envision a world in which researchers have ready access to the data needed and the tools required to make data driven discoveries that increase our scientific knowledge and improve the quality of life. We architect ecosystems of large-scale commons of research data, computing resources, applications, tools, and services for the broader research community to use data at scale to pursue scientific inquiry and accelerate discovery. Learn more at https://gdc.cancer.gov/ , https://gen3.org/ , https://stats.gen3.org/ , and https://ctds.uchicago.edu/. This at-will position is wholly or partially funded by contractual grant funding which is renewed under provisions set by the grantor of the contract. Employment will be contingent upon the continued receipt of these grant funds and satisfactory job performance.<p><br></p><u><strong>Job Information</strong></u><p><br></p>Software Engineers in Test for various &amp; unanticipated worksites throughout the U.S. (HQ: Chicago, IL). Work with cloud computing infrastructure primarily based on OpenStack to architect and implement quality assurance practices across all phases of the testing lifecycle. Coding includes the full stack including systems orchestration, API development, algorithms and data structures, and user interfaces. Projects span management, sharing, and provenance of large data sets, automation, metrics, and scheduling for cloud computing, large scale pipe lining of next-generation sequence analysis, transfer programs/protocols for high-speed networks and resource visualization. Responsible for creating the project Software Quality Assurance Plan. Create and implement QA Test Plans and SOPs Test functionalities prior to each release on each tier (QA, Stage and Production). Design and evaluate tests. Test the product to be compliant with technical specifications and policy requirements, including unit testing, automated regression testing. Identify necessary teams to successfully complete the Test Phase Contribute to Master Test Plan and Strategy by identifying appropriate test techniques and tools that ensure product quality and test completion. Develop the test case documents according to the Master Test Plan/Test Strategy. Facilitate triage of defects and assist in defect investigation and escalation. Walk through the test results with the team and communicate status to management and project leadership. Assist with the implementation of automated testing tools. Serves as a liaison with internal and external collaborators on various research projects. Technical Environment: Openstack (GDC); Unix/Linux; Python; JavaScript; Go; Kubernetes; Docker; version control.<p><br></p><strong><u>Education</u></strong><p><br></p><u>Additional Requirements</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Information Systems or related field plus 2 years of experience in the job offered, as a QA Engineer or in software QA/Testing required. Required Skills: all phases of the test lifecycle; design and evaluate tests; test case development, automated regression testing; Unix/Linux; Python; JavaScript; Kubernetes; Docker; version control. Background check including review of conviction history required. May work remote. (*Masters degree in Information Systems or related field plus 1 year of experience in the job offered, as a QA Engineer or in software QA/Testing also acceptable).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Schedule</strong>: Full time<p><br></p><strong>Application Information</strong><p><br></p><em>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.</em><p><br></p>When applying, the document(s) <strong><u>MUST</u></strong> be uploaded via the <strong><u>My Experience</u></strong> page, in the section titled <strong><u>Application Documents</u></strong> of the application.<p><br></p><u>Benefit Eligibility</u><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><strong><u>Requires Compliance with University Covid-19 Vaccination Requirement</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Pay Frequency</u><p><br></p>Monthly<p><br></p><u>Pay Range</u><p><br></p><strong><u>Depends On Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><u>Scheduled Weekly Hours</u><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><u>Union</u><p><br></p>Non-Union<p><br></p><u>Job is Exempt</u><p><br></p>Yes<p><br></p><u>Drug Test Required</u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><strong><u>Motor Vehicle Record Inquiry Required</u></strong><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Health Screen Required</u><p><br></p>No<p><br></p><u>Posting Date</u><p><br></p>2023-07-11<p><br></p><u>Remove from Posting On or Before</u><p><br></p>2024-01-11<p><br></p><strong><u>Posting Statement</u></strong><p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information please see the University's Notice of Nondiscrimination.<p><br></p>Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call 773-702-5800 or submit a request via Applicant Inquiry Form.<p><br></p>We seek a diverse pool of applicants who wish to join an academic community that places the highest value on rigorous inquiry and encourages a diversity of perspectives, experiences, groups of individuals, and ideas to inform and stimulate intellectual challenge, engagement, and exchange.<p><br></p>All offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes a review of conviction history. A conviction does not automatically preclude University employment. Rather, the University considers conviction information on a case-by-case basis and assesses the nature of the offense, the circumstances surrounding it, the proximity in time of the conviction, and its relevance to the position.<p><br></p>The University of Chicago's Annual Security &amp; Fire Safety Report (Report) provides information about University offices and programs that provide safety support, crime and fire statistics, emergency response and communications plans, and other policies and information. The Report can be accessed online at: http://securityreport.uchicago.edu. Paper copies of the Report are available, upon request, from the University of Chicago Police Department, 850 E. 61st Street, Chicago, IL 60637.

title: Salesforce Architect
description: <strong>Start a Rewarding Career with Alliant </strong><p><br></p>The Sr. Applications Security Engineer will assist in leading and coordinating the day to day work stream of assigned team focused on validating that application services are designed and implemented with high security standards, meet business objectives, and are completed within planned timelines. Oversees the analysis of the security of applications in tandem with their underlying services, including connected dependencies such as middle-tier systems and databases. Addresses legacy and emerging security issues, and implements repeatable secure development practices to reduce the introduction of program design flaws that may lead to exploitation. Communicates with the appropriate technical and leadership teams to ensure a focus on risk mitigation, allowing for business continuity, but without negligent risk when issues are uncovered. Leads the assessment of applications for weaknesses and finding resolutions before they can be abused. Assesses the security of applications for business-to-business initiatives, third-party relationships, outsourced solutions and vendors. Recommends programmatic controls, and monitors and manages secure development practices to address modern day issues.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Assists management with the day to day tasks of the assigned team by coordinating work assignments to ensure tasks and projects are completed within planned deadlines and the results meet business objectives. </li><li> Leads and coordinates vulnerability and penetration testing. </li><li> Reviews the documentation of security findings and ensure review procedures are followed, and includes reasonable methods to secure. </li><li> Leads team meetings that facilitate secure design and foster an environment of collaboration. </li><li> Attends and provides input in projects and change management committees including interacting with business units and technical teams to understand what is coming and how their projects can be more secure from the beginning. </li><li> Coordinates and leads the work of assigned teams with developers to provide repetitive validation testing prior to production while allowing for a continuous cycle of development followed by application security assessments. </li><li> Monitors the security community for public-facing security issues, as well as to learn new tactics that can be used in testing. </li><li> Ensures the team follows a defined security review process to ensure an automated and repeatable process. </li><li> Coordinates performance testing to stress the limitations of security solutions while ensuring business innovation and day-to-day processes are not negatively impacted. </li><li> Trains others on secure coding practices. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Min/Preferred Education Level Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Minimum<p><br></p>4 Year / Bachelors Degree<p><br></p>Computer Science or Related<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>Graduate Degree<p><br></p>Computer Science or Related<p><br></p><strong><u>Years Of Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Min/Preferred </strong><strong> Years of Experience </strong><strong> Comments </strong><p><br></p>Minimum<p><br></p>5<p><br></p>Cybersecurity, Compliance/Risk Management, Application Programming<p><br></p><strong>In Lieu of Education</strong><p><br></p><strong> Years of Experience </strong><strong> Comments </strong><p><br></p>8<p><br></p>Cybersecurity including Compliance/Risk Management<p><br></p><strong>When you’re happy, we’re happy!</strong><p><br></p>As a thank you for joining our team, you’ll benefit from:<p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive medical, dental, and free vision benefits </li><li> Competitive compensation plan </li><li> Contributions towards gym memberships </li><li> Generous PTO and banking holidays off </li></ul><p><br></p>Adhere to and ensure compliance of all business transactions with policy and process of the Bank Secrecy Act. Ensures compliance with all applicable state and federal laws, company procedures and policies. Maintains integrity and ethics in all actions and conversations with or regarding credit union members and their accounts; complies with Privacy Act directives.<p><br></p>The responsibilities listed do not contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this position. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.<p><br></p><strong>Still not convinced?</strong><p><br></p>For more details you can also visit our Glassdoor and <u> LinkedIn </u>profiles.

title: Software Engineer in Test
description: <em>At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us.</em><p><br></p><em>The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees’ personal and professional lives.</em><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary: </strong><p><br></p>The Data Science team at Horizon Therapeutics is looking for an extraordinary data scientist who is passionate about crafting, developing, and fielding data science solutions that drives impact for patients.<p><br></p>The Data Scientist, Medical Research will partner with Horizon’s various medical teams (Med Affairs, R&amp;D, Commercial Development) to develop insights and understanding from data. This role will leverage cutting edge data science technologies and methods to help produce health outcomes publications, as well as uncover deeper insights about how our life-changing medicines are being used. The Data Scientist will be a key functional contributor, and must understand the medical landscape surrounding our products, as well as the analytics techniques necessary to produce publishable insights. They should be comfortable working with large, complex, and noisy datasets. The data scientist will automate recurring deliverables, manipulate transactional data to usable formats, and present clear visualizations.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities and Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop a deep understanding of available data sources, including data capture methodologies, sampling requirements, and descriptive statistics</li><li>Implement advanced analytics in support of our Medical Affairs, R&amp;D, and Commercial Development teams, including applications of machine learning and statistically sound research</li><li>Create insightful visualizations that can help a non-technical audience make sense of complex datasets</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for leveraging data science to solve unmet medical needs</li><li>Transform uncovered analytics insights into medical publications</li><li>Support ad hoc data projects and tasks as needed</li><li>Ability to manage multiple projects in an ambiguous environment with shifting priorities and time-pressure</li><li>Excellent problem solving capabilities</li><li>Attention to detail – this role will be helping to product publishable medical abstracts</li><li>Strong communication skills (verbal and written); proven ability to work cross functionally and liaise across a complex set of stakeholders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS in Statistics, Operational Research, Computer Science, or other quantitative discipline</li><li>Master’s degree preferred but not required</li><li>Health outcomes research experience strongly preferred, particularly using large claims datasets</li><li>Track record of innovative thinking with machine learning and statistical algorithms</li><li>Proven experience with the PyData stack, (Python, pandas, sci-kit learn), distributed computing technologies for machine learning, such as Apache Spark and Linux</li><li>Experience in biotech / pharmaceuticals preferred but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.</em>

title: Sr. Application Security Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>As an Architect: Salesforce Integration - supporting Bond and Specialty Insurance, you will collaborate with senior Technology and Business leaders and apply your knowledge of modern technology to influence and innovate solutions that impact the business. In this role we will look to you to:<br><ul><li>Architect integrations to/from existing systems with Salesforce via APIs &amp; Events </li><li>Provide architecture “runway” for engineering teams by running POC/POTs </li><li>Partner with value stream/engineering team to accelerate their learning and delivery in the cloud </li><li>To provide enhancement to current process <br><br></li></ul><strong>What Will You Do? <br></strong><ul><li>Architecture responsibility within a major segment of Technology Architecture in support of the Bond and Specialty Insurance business unit </li><li>Leads technology proof of concepts to ensure feasibility of architecture solutions </li><li>Hands-on prototyping of new technology solutions </li><li>Partner with Software Engineering to execute proof of technologies </li><li>Provides architecture direction for engineers in support of a technical pattern </li><li>Displays strong thought leadership in pursuit of modern architecture principals and technology modernization </li><li>Drives continuous technology transformation to minimize technical debt </li><li>Create a partnership with Software Engineering </li><li>Looks for opportunities to capitalize on technology advances through analysis of key industry and technology trends to assess potential impact on the enterprise </li><li>Participates in defining target state technology architecture and roadmaps </li><li>Ensures alignment of IT initiatives with the target state </li><li>Builds strong partnership with engineering to ensure proper alignment of skills with technology direction </li><li>Continuously improve efficiency and effectiveness of the architecture </li><li>Perform other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have? <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s in technology related field or equivalent with 10+ years of technology Engineering experience </li><li>Hands-on knowledge of Salesforce integration </li><li>Practical experience using system integration tools (AWS, Mulesoft, Kafka and/or equivalents) </li><li>Organizational experience in an agile operating model </li><li>Established work in proof of concepts and technology </li><li>Strong proven Software Engineering experience </li><li>Supports technology target state, roadmaps that aligned to Short- and Long-term business goals </li><li>Insurance technology experience desired </li><li>Strong grasp of value creation and business capability models </li><li>Innovation and Continuous Improvement </li><li>Must be passionate about technology transformations </li><li>Has hands on experience in the last 3 years </li><li>Executed technology modernization initiatives including migration to cloud native and API Strategy </li><li>Current experience with Cloud, APIs, accelerators, DevSecOps </li><li>Strong architecture experience on Cloud </li><li>Good understanding of security </li><li>Experienced with large scale technology platforms <br><br></li></ul><strong>What is a Must Have? <br><br></strong>Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in work experience.<br><br>Five years of experience in engineering software or analytic applications within a line of business area
description_json: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>As an Architect: Salesforce Integration - supporting Bond and Specialty Insurance, you will collaborate with senior Technology and Business leaders and apply your knowledge of modern technology to influence and innovate solutions that impact the business. In this role we will look to you to:<br><ul><li>Architect integrations to/from existing systems with Salesforce via APIs &amp; Events </li><li>Provide architecture “runway” for engineering teams by running POC/POTs </li><li>Partner with value stream/engineering team to accelerate their learning and delivery in the cloud </li><li>To provide enhancement to current process <br><br></li></ul><strong>What Will You Do? <br></strong><ul><li>Architecture responsibility within a major segment of Technology Architecture in support of the Bond and Specialty Insurance business unit </li><li>Leads technology proof of concepts to ensure feasibility of architecture solutions </li><li>Hands-on prototyping of new technology solutions </li><li>Partner with Software Engineering to execute proof of technologies </li><li>Provides architecture direction for engineers in support of a technical pattern </li><li>Displays strong thought leadership in pursuit of modern architecture principals and technology modernization </li><li>Drives continuous technology transformation to minimize technical debt </li><li>Create a partnership with Software Engineering </li><li>Looks for opportunities to capitalize on technology advances through analysis of key industry and technology trends to assess potential impact on the enterprise </li><li>Participates in defining target state technology architecture and roadmaps </li><li>Ensures alignment of IT initiatives with the target state </li><li>Builds strong partnership with engineering to ensure proper alignment of skills with technology direction </li><li>Continuously improve efficiency and effectiveness of the architecture </li><li>Perform other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have? <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s in technology related field or equivalent with 10+ years of technology Engineering experience </li><li>Hands-on knowledge of Salesforce integration </li><li>Practical experience using system integration tools (AWS, Mulesoft, Kafka and/or equivalents) </li><li>Organizational experience in an agile operating model </li><li>Established work in proof of concepts and technology </li><li>Strong proven Software Engineering experience </li><li>Supports technology target state, roadmaps that aligned to Short- and Long-term business goals </li><li>Insurance technology experience desired </li><li>Strong grasp of value creation and business capability models </li><li>Innovation and Continuous Improvement </li><li>Must be passionate about technology transformations </li><li>Has hands on experience in the last 3 years </li><li>Executed technology modernization initiatives including migration to cloud native and API Strategy </li><li>Current experience with Cloud, APIs, accelerators, DevSecOps </li><li>Strong architecture experience on Cloud </li><li>Good understanding of security </li><li>Experienced with large scale technology platforms <br><br></li></ul><strong>What is a Must Have? <br><br></strong>Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in work experience.<br><br>Five years of experience in engineering software or analytic applications within a line of business area

title: Data Scientist, Medical Research
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>Our Client is seeking UiPath Developers with the following skill sets:<br><br><strong>Required Job Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor Degree and 4 years Information Technology experience OR Technical Certification and/or College Courses and 6 year Information Technology experience OR 8 years Information Technology experience.</li><li> Possess ability to manage workload, manage multiple priorities, and manage conflicts with customers/employees/managers, as applicable.</li><li> Experience in traditional app languages (Java / Scala / C++).</li><li> Experience in scripting languages (BASH / PYTHON).</li><li> Experience in cloud computing technologies (SaaS / IaaS / PaaS)</li><li> Experience in application configuration.</li><li> SDLC Methodology (Agile / Scrum / Iterative Development).</li><li> System performance management.</li><li> Systems change / configuration management.</li><li> Business requirements management.</li><li> Problem solving /analytical thinking.</li><li> Creative thinking.</li><li> Ability to execute.</li><li> Travel availability up to 20%<br><br></li></ul>Preferred Job Qualifications:<br><ul><li> At least 2 years of experience with UIPath OR 3 years of experience with other RPA platform(s) (Automation Anywhere, Blue Prism, etc.)</li><li> At least 2 years of experience in several areas of RPA (Desktop Applications, Web Applications, Citrix Environments, Salesforce, Excel, Mainframe and/or Legacy Systems)</li><li> Previous hands-on experience with at least one high level programming language (.Net, Java, VB, C#/C, HTML/CSS, Python, Web Services, Mainframe, Web Applications, SQL, Data Integration Tools, Technical Automation Tools)</li><li> Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior Driven Development (BDD)</li><li> Strong CICD and DevOps (“shift left”) mindset</li><li> UiPath Advanced Certification<br><br></li></ul>
