title: Salesforce Architect
description: This role is with Capital One. WayUp is partnering with Capital One to hire top talent.<p><br></p>  Key Role Details  <p><br></p><ul><li>Full-time new hires for this role will start as a cohort in a rotational program in either February 2024 or August 2024.</li><li>This role is a full-time associate position within a two-year rotational program, designed as a career accelerator to foster the next generation of leading talent.</li><li>Rotations allow for hands-on experience in two distinct roles.</li><li>Associates who participate in this program may choose to remain in their final role placement upon completion of the program or explore other opportunities at Capital One.</li><li>Participation in the program requires that you are located in the continental United States with in-person attendance at your assigned location, in accordance with Capital One’s [_hybrid working model_](https://www.capitalonecareers.com/a-hybrid-work-model-at-capital-one-101#:~:text=How%20our%20hybrid%20model%20works,independent%20and%20heads%2Ddown%20work.).   Basic Qualifications  </li><li>Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a bachelor’s degree or higher with an expectation that degree will be obtained by August 2024 or earlier.</li><li>At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.     Business Analyst Associate - 2024   As a Business Analyst associate in the Analyst Development Program (ADP), _you’ll apply your analytical and strategic skills to impactful challenges that drive company growth and resilience — like launching new products and customer experiences, crafting our marketing and digital strategy, and analyzing the business impacts of lending decisions, just to name a few. The projects span across the financial services spectrum, but are connected by putting you in the driver’s seat to make an impact to our businesses, our customers and our mission. You’ll have the opportunity to explore and learn, while being mentored by senior leaders._ Whether you want to develop critical business acumen or refine your technical skills through coding and modeling, you’ll leverage the experience gained rotating through two distinct roles to accelerate your career growth. ADP graduates go on to senior leadership positions at Capital One and leading tech companies, startups and top MBA programs. With the strong business foundation, technical skills, and alumni network you’ll develop as an ADP, the career possibilities are endless. As a Business Analyst Associate in the Analyst Development Program (ADP), you’ll:</li><li>Launch your business career. Develop strategic problem-solving, quantitative analytics and communication skills. Armed with our best-in-class analytical practices, you’ll partner across teams to create new solutions to major challenges. Find your path and passion by choosing from a range of strategy, product and marketing teams across the company.</li><li>Prioritize your wellbeing. Create your definition of balance through flexible hours, locations, resources and benefits, while working in an environment that emphasizes creativity, collaboration, innovation and fun.</li><li>Build and grow your network. Establish an impactful network of peers, leaders and mentors who will help you develop a clear and accelerated path for advancement.</li><li>Act as an owner. Be a key decision maker and business owner, driving recommendations, implementing solutions and realizing your impact, all while collaborating with senior leaders across product, tech, sales, operations, design, data science, engineering and finance.</li><li>Be a change agent. Help people improve their relationship with their money. Transform the communities we serve through financial inclusion—helping to identify the right products for the right customers, assessing risks and optimizing our lending practices.</li><li>Find answers. Develop hypotheses and set up your own analytical frameworks to test for the best solutions. Scope operational feasibility, lead implementation efforts and monitor the success of new initiatives.</li><li>Reimagine banking. Use information, data, analytics, ingenuity and empathy in innovative ways to deliver technology-driven solutions for our customers. You’ll love your job if:</li><li>You ask why, explore and bring your unique perspective to the table. You’re comfortable with ambiguity and constantly seek out new challenges.</li><li>You have a desire to take action, try new things, and fail fast so you can grow quickly</li><li>You’re organized and can juggle multiple deliverables while utilizing data analysis, technology and human-centered design to create solutions for our customers.</li><li>You thrive in a collaborative and inclusive team environment where diverse perspectives and backgrounds are valued and celebrated.</li><li>You have the desire and ability to connect and empathize with your colleagues and customers.</li><li>You always keep the people around you in the loop and are excited to communicate ideas clearly to help your colleagues understand the “why” and key priorities. About Capital One Over the last 30 years, Capital One has grown from a small credit card start-up pioneering the use of predictive modeling to democratize credit into one of the fastest-growing and most dynamic financial technology companies forever changing the way people and businesses interact with money. We believe our success is fueled by data and insights, deep customer understanding, innovative business strategy and a culture that prioritizes our associates’ growth and wellbeing. Our incredibly talented associates are passionate about changing banking for good and have the humility to understand that collaboration, fresh perspectives, ingenuity and empathy are all needed to make it happen. The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked. New York City (Hybrid On-Site): $113,000 - $113,000 for Analyst Development Program Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate’s offer letter. This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan. Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at the [Capital One Careers website](https://www.capitalonecareers.com/benefits). Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level. No agencies please. Capital One is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, physical and mental disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/assignment, citizenship, pregnancy or maternity, protected veteran status, or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City’s Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia’s Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at [RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com](mailto:RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com). All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to [_Careers@capitalone.com_](mailto:Careers@capitalone.com) Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site. Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).</li></ul>

title: UiPath Developer
description: <strong>Duration</strong>: 5+ months<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 8 years of IT Experience with minimum of 5 years IBM BPM Development with certification.</li><li>At least 2 project implementation in IBM BPM 8.0 or above</li><li>Very good written verbal communication Can connect with Business Stakeholders understand the business</li><li>Primary Skills Must have Very good understanding of BPMN 2 04.Very good knowledge on Coach &amp; BPM UI (Spark UI) implementation</li><li>Good knowledge on REST API its implementation</li><li>Must have implemented Web services integration services controls the flow of process execution decision making and exception management across multiple organizational roles and systems applications</li><li>Tailors user screens for each process activity to enable end users to interact with multiple internal external systems through a single interface</li><li>Good database skills with excellent query writing skills</li><li>Can build the executable processes with limited requirement to showcase business</li><li>Knowledge on Content Management System &amp; its integration with IBM B</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: Application Engineering
description: <strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Ubiquiti, Inc. is a leader across three areas: high-capacity distributed Internet access, unified information technology, and next-gen consumer electronics for home and personal use. With over 100 million devices shipped in over 200 countries and territories in the world, Ubiquiti aims to connect everyone to everything, everywhere.<p><br></p>Opportunity<p><br></p>We recently launched UniFi Talk - a full-featured, affordable, subscription-based, Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) system that we designed for small and medium-sized businesses looking for a plug-and-play solution. We’re looking for a talented and motivated candidate to join the UniFi Talk team as a Backend Engineer. As part of our team, you would help us build and scale our world-class communications products.<p><br></p>What You’ll Do<p><br></p><ul><li> Work within a small cross-functional team to deliver and own world-class communications products </li><li> Develop resilient, secure, and scalable cloud solutions </li><li> Maintain a good programming style and stay up-to-date with the latest technology and trends </li><li> Actively participate in projects and voice your ideas and solutions </li></ul><p><br></p>What You’ll Need<p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive experience with Node.js </li><li> Strong database experience (SQL, NoSQL) </li><li> Solid knowledge of VoIP protocols - SIP, RTP, WebRTC, SDP, RTCP, TCP, UDP </li><li> Experience with cloud media infrastructure - load balancers, gateways, Session Border Controllers, SIP and RTP proxies, STUN/TURN </li><li> Experience with configuring PBXs </li><li> Effective written and verbal communication skills in English </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> International work environment and work with global development teams </li><li> Excellent work conditions </li><li> Compensation package matching global standards - we can and do offer great pay, perks, and benefits </li><li> Medical insurance </li><li> Flexible work hours (as required) </li></ul><p><br></p>This position is eligible either as a remote opportunity or a hybrid opportunity.

title: Capital One, Business Analyst Associate - 2024 - Application via WayUp
description: <p>**Job Title**: Senior Java Engineer **Duration:** 6 months+ **Location:** Chicago, IL- **Hybrid** **Description** The Senior Java Engineer will design, code, test, and analyze software programs and applications. This includes researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production lifecycle. This role will also analyze and amend software errors in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports where required. The position responsibilities outlined below are not all encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. **Responsibilities:** · Work with Product team to determine requirements and propose approaches to address users' needs · Analyze requirements to determine approach/proposed solution · Design and Build Solutions using relevant programming languages · Thoroughly test solutions using relevant approaches and tools · Conduct research into software-related issues and products · Bring out-of-box thinking and solutions to address challenging issues · Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment · Work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment · Flexible and adaptable to learning and understanding new technologies · Highly self-motivated and directed **Experience and Skills:** · Strong verbal and written communication skills · Demonstrate integrity and maturity, and a constructive approach to challenges · Experience working as an application designer and software developer for enterprise applications · Hands-on software troubleshooting experience · Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities · Experience with specific phases of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, requirements analysis, design, development, and testing · Knowledge/Experience of database design and file management techniques · Knowledge/Experience of Service Oriented Architectures · Knowledge/Experience of Web based Architectures · Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment · Work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment · Flexible and adaptable to learning and understanding new technologies · Highly self-motivated and directed · Open minded, solution This includes researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production lifecycle. This role will also analyze and amend software errors in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports where required. The position responsibilities outlined below are not all encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. **Responsibilities:** · Work with Product team to determine requirements and propose approaches to address users' needs · Analyze requirements to determine approach/proposed solution · Design and Build Solutions using relevant programming languages · Thoroughly test solutions using relevant phases of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, requirements analysis, design, development, and testing · Knowledge/Experience of database design and file management title: Software Developer (contract)
description: <strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The HRIT Software Engineer reports to the Technical Director of Software Applications and is responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining Workday integrations. This includes integrations developed using EIBs, Core Connectors, Document Transformations and Workday Studio. This position will develop and maintain custom reports and dashboards in Workday to enhance our user’s availability to data. They will also support Workday Phase X projects as we continue to expand our Workday footprint modules in use. The right candidate will have the opportunity to learn how to configure Workday HCM and further enhance their development skills on Non-Workday IT software development projects as time allows.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Designs, develops, tests, and maintains Workday Integrations</li><li>Develops and maintains custom reports and dashboards</li><li>Develops and maintains documentation and release notes</li><li>Collaborates with cross functional teams and 3rd party vendors</li><li>Supports Phase X Workday implementations projects</li><li>Prepares end-user documentation or training materials as needed</li><li>Communicates with end users and corporate personnel to identify and solve issues</li><li>Other job related duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related developmental technology</li><li>Workday Pro certification in Integrations required</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of Workday integration experience required (including EIB, Core Connectors, Document Transformations and Workday Studio)</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of Workday reporting experience required</li><li>Thorough knowledge of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, development and testing methodologies</li><li>Experience with web services, SOAP, REST API, XML and XSLT</li><li>Strong analytical and problem solving abilities</li><li>Strong written and oral communication skills</li><li>Ability to work and communicate with stakeholders effectively</li><li>Determine work priorities and follow through on tasks in a timely manner.</li><li>Ability to analyze and format datasets with Microsoft Excel</li><li>Maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>POOLCORP is a drug-free company and Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. The Company understands, respects, and values diversity – unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas, and opinions – while striving to be inclusive of all people. This commitment is critical to our success as a global company as we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Hiring and promotional decisions are based solely on the qualifications required for the job to be filled.</em>

description: <ul><li>Vast growth opportunities, long retention, up to 20% bonuses|Opportunity with company exponentially accelerating revenue and overall growth<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is a industry leader in the customer loyalty space. The leadership within the company is constantly finding new ways to adapt to market changes and opportunities in the sports market for youth athletes and thier families. In order to do so, they are in need of smart, self-sufficient, and accountable software engineers excelling in problem-solving. My client is planning on staying agile and flexible in regards to strategies and best practices. Staying up to date on current trends as well as paving the way to new ones will be essential in this role.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Autonomy on project implementation</li><li>Gamifying marketing strategies for clients</li><li>Efficient in coding review</li><li>Reporting directly to owners</li><li>Agile work-flow </li><li>Collaborating with leadership onshore and offshore<br><br></li></ul>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Full stack coding experience in C# and .NET frameworks (5-7 years).</li><li>Good communication skill.</li><li>Loves building things and working in a team.</li><li>Eager to move into a lead role with rapid expected company growth.</li><li>Comfortable working in a remote role.</li><li>Dependable individual who can take initiative on cleaning up and expanding projects.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Salary based on experience and interviews</li><li>Expected company growth</li><li>Growth in individual role in short and long-term</li><li>Innovative projects</li><li>Reporting directly to CTO</li><li>Autonomy on projects</li><li>Great culture focused on building a self-driven team</li><li>Full medical, dental, vision</li><li>Generous PTO</li><li>Strong employee benefits and perks<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6115166</strong>

description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>We currently have an opening in our Chicago office for a Transportation Engineer with a minimum of 11 years of experience for our Transportation &amp; Infrastructure division. You will have the opportunity to lead as Project Engineer on a variety of public projects with a focus on leading projects towards Design Approval for Counties and IDOT.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li> Provide support and oversight during Phase I projects</li><li> Assisting with assigned tasks on Phase II projects</li><li> The study and design of highway facilities</li><li> Preparation of reports, drawings, specifications, calculations, and monitoring work for compliance to applicable codes, accepted engineering practices and agency guidelines.</li><li> Working as a project engineer or discipline lead for oversight</li><li> Lead and mentor junior level team highway engineers<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Skills<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering</li><li> Professional Engineer (PE) license is required, with a current Illinois PE license preferred</li><li> Required Experience – minimum 11 years of experience in highway studies and designs</li><li> Obtained Design Approval for a Federally Approved Categorical Exclusion project as the Project Engineer for an IDOT project</li><li> Obtained Design Approval for a State Approved Categorical Exclusion project as the Project Engineer for an IDOT project</li><li>Exposure to and general understanding of the NEPA process</li><li> Proficiency in MicroStation and/or OpenRoads Designer (ORD)</li><li> Experience with Illinois Department of Transportation (IDOT)</li><li>Good oral and written communication skills</li><li> Ability to build strong relationships</li><li> Good time management skills, a strong work ethic, and a willing desire to learn<br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Skills<br></strong><ul><li>Experience preparing an Environmental Impact Statement or Environmental Assessment</li><li> Familiar or experience with Planning and Environmental Linkage (PEL) projects</li><li> Familiar or experience with Tollway Master Plan projects</li><li> Experience using ProjectWise is a plus</li><li> An understanding of other disciplines such as drainage, maintenance of traffic, signal design, erosion control, structures, and construction</li><li>Expertise with 3D modeling and BIM for Infrastructure using Bentley Products</li><li>Previous experience with the following clients is desired: Illinois Tollway, Chicago Department of Transportation (CDOT), counties and municipalities in the greater Chicago area and familiarity with their policies and procedures<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. title: HRIT Software Engineer I
description: <ul><li>Lead developers working in C#, ASP.NET, .Net Core, JavaScript |Translate business requirements or needs into actionable software development<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 4M on-boarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify scheduling, planning, and making payments for parents<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Utilize HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React Native</li><li>Use and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps</li><li>Create and test software prototypes</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary</li><li>Operate in a scrum/agile environment, working towards quality code and quality products.</li><li>You will contribute to development, design and test automation best practices and procedures.</li><li>Contribute to important team culture and contribute code to efforts across a fast-growing company</li><li>Support, maintain and upgrade code and participate in implementation of a complex system</li><li>Evaluate and recommend software technologies in these areas, evaluate alternatives and analyze problems with data infrastructures</li><li>Mentor junior members of the team<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>7+ years of coding experience</li><li>4 years of experience working with React Native</li><li>Having both mobile and web application development preferred but not required</li><li>Experience utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React</li><li>Experience working within an Agile environment</li><li>Experience working within the Cloud</li><li>Effective communication, interpersonal and team skills</li><li>Computer Science or related degree</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, up to 190K depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive health-care plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>On-boarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Daniela Rodríguez Flores<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6115190</strong>

title: Software Engineer C#/.NET
description: Ø As a CNC Programmer you will be responsible for making a CNC program from the customers' print.<p><br></p>Ø You will determine the best and most efficient way to manufacture a part.<p><br></p>Ø You will use Gibbs Cam and Esprit Cam to generate a 3D image of the part before actual machining as well as analyze the rendered part against the customer's solid model.<p><br></p>Ø We are a family-owned medical device manufacturer focused on providing employees a safe place to enjoy their work day, build technical and personal skills, all while creating a better life for them and their families.<p><br></p>Ø With the help of these amazing team members, we set the standard in the medical industry in terms of quality, service, and creativity.<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications/Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3+ Years' experience on applicable machining assets</li><li> Ability to read and comprehend blueprints (including GD&amp;T features such as true position and profile of a surface)</li><li> Advanced knowledge of CNC G-Code</li><li> Ability to use programming software; Gibbs Cam and Esprit (preferred)</li><li> Understand machining properties of various raw materials</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Engineer the way to run a part</li><li> Generate tool path from 2D geometry and 3D surfaces</li><li> Troubleshoot CNC program</li><li> Productivity improvements - improve previously run parts</li><li> Come up with a list of tooling and speeds and feeds for parts to be manufactured</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 401K</li><li> Paid Holidays</li><li> Paid Vacation</li><li> Opportunity for Flexible Schedule</li><li> Health Insurance</li><li> Dental Insurance</li><li> Vision Insurance</li><li> Life Insurance</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Shift</strong><p><br></p>Day Shift (8:00AM - 4:30PM, Mon - Fri) *With opportunity for overtime before regular shift and Saturday

Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Selected Software Developer will:<br><ul><li>Use React Native for all mobile development projects.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in a Fullstack capacity.</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary.</li><li>Develop SQL database-driven web interfaces.</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences with rich functionality.</li><li>Take charge of story development without needing micromanagement.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The Successful Software Developer has:<br><ul><li>4+ years of Fullstack experience.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Boot camp certificate (with at least 2 additional years of experience).</li><li>Strong proficiency with React Native.</li><li>Exposure or experience working in C#/.NET is highly preferred but not required.</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br><br></strong>What's on Offer for the Selected Software Developer?<br><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, in the range of 120k-140k depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive healthcare plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Hybrid in the office in Northbrook up to twice a week, can make exceptions as needed.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>Onboarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6115094</strong>

title: Midwest/Remote - Software Engineer (React Native)
description: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>STV is an award-winning national leader consistently ranking among the country's top companies in the design and planning of infrastructure and transportation systems. More than 100 years old, the firm provides comprehensive architectural, engineering, planning, environmental, and construction management services for public and private sector clients. Our success is the direct result of our employees' commitment to innovation and quality across all 40 offices and over 2800 people nationwide.<br><br>We have a thriving Transportation &amp; Infrastructure practice with a close-knit, team-oriented group that is growing rapidly. Due to our success, we need to continue to add resources to assist with the delivery of our current extensive backlog of work. This backlog includes tasks associated with various infrastructure improvement projects for Illinois government agencies, as well as numerous private sector clients and work sharing with other STV Offices.<br><br>Perform the duties of a Construction Manager or Resident Engineer on large scale transit construction projects.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities Include<br></strong><ul><li>client interface</li><li>manage meetings</li><li>stakeholder coordination</li><li>staff supervision</li><li>site safety</li><li>overall project management</li><li>quality assurance</li><li>documentation.<br><br></li></ul>The role will include training, coaching, and managing staff that can include field engineers, office engineers, project controls managers, quality managers, and safety managers.<br><br><strong>Duties Include<br></strong><ul><li>Provide guidance, leadership and training to construction management (CM) team</li><li>Communicate with clients, design engineers and architects, contractors, and staff on various construction projects</li><li>Coordinate with external stakeholders</li><li>Read and interpret complex contract documents</li><li>Oversee projects to ensure that the work is executed on time and on budget and in accordance with the client’s requirements and within company policies and procedures</li><li>Provide work assignments and review performance to ensure the efficient, cost-effective utilization of staff<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Professional Engineer's License registered in the State of Illinois (PE) preferred.</li><li>10 or more years of resident engineer/ construction management experience managing transit/rail construction projects</li><li>Computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite, and experience with various scheduling software including Oracle Primavera P6 Professional<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The following pay ranges are STV’s good-faith salary estimates for every presently available position. Please note that the final salary offered for any position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or description_json: <strong>Description<br><br></strong>STV is an award-winning national leader consistently ranking among the country's top companies in the design and planning of infrastructure and transportation systems. More than 100 years old, the firm provides comprehensive architectural, engineering, planning, environmental, and construction management services for public and private sector clients. Our success is the direct result of our employees' commitment to innovation and quality across all 40 offices and over 2800 people nationwide.<br><br>We have a thriving Transportation &amp; Infrastructure practice with a close-knit, team-oriented group that is growing rapidly. Due to our success, we need to continue to add resources to assist with the delivery of our current extensive backlog of work. This backlog includes tasks associated with various infrastructure improvement projects for Illinois government agencies, as well as numerous private sector clients and work sharing with other STV Offices.<br><br>Perform the duties of a Construction Manager or Resident Engineer on large scale transit construction projects.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities Include<br></strong><ul><li>client interface</li><li>manage meetings</li><li>stakeholder coordination</li><li>staff supervision</li><li>site safety</li><li>overall project management</li><li>quality assurance</li><li>documentation.<br><br></li></ul>The role will include training, coaching, and managing staff that can include field engineers, office engineers, project controls managers, quality managers, and safety managers.<br><br><strong>Duties Include<br></strong><ul><li>Provide guidance, leadership and training to construction management (CM) team</li><li>Communicate with clients, design engineers and architects, contractors, and staff on various construction projects</li><li>Coordinate with external stakeholders</li><li>Read and interpret complex contract documents</li><li>Oversee projects to ensure that the work is executed on time and on budget and in accordance with the client’s requirements and within company policies and procedures</li><li>Provide work assignments and review performance to ensure the efficient, cost-effective utilization of staff<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Professional Engineer's License registered in the State of Illinois (PE) preferred.</li><li>10 or more years of resident engineer/ construction management experience managing transit/rail construction projects</li><li>Computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite, and experience with various scheduling software including Oracle Primavera P6 Professional<br><br></li></ul>Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At STV, we are fully committed to expanding our culture of diversity and inclusion, one that will reflect the clients we serve and the communities we work in, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.<br><br>STV offers the following benefits<br><ul><li> Health insurance, including an option with a Health Savings Account</li><li> Dental insurance</li><li> Vision insurance</li><li> Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care and Transit and Parking where applicable)</li><li> Disability insurance</li><li> Life Insurance and Accidental Death &amp; Dismemberment</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li> Retirement Counseling</li><li> Employee Assistance Program</li><li> Paid Time Off (16 days)</li><li> Paid Holidays (8 days)</li><li> Back-Up Dependent Care (up to 10 days per year)</li><li> Parental Leave (up to 80 hours)</li><li> Continuing Education Program</li><li> Professional Licensure and Society Memberships<br><br></li></ul>STV aims to pay fairly and equitable commensurate with experience and capabilities across all of our positions. These pay ranges represent a good faith effort to provide a fair and reasonable expected salary, however, please note that the salary offered for any position may be outside of this range based on selected candidate’s location, experience and capabilities.<br><br>STV is committed to paying all its employees in a fair, equitable, and transparent manner. The following pay ranges are STV’s good-faith salary estimates for every presently available position. Please note that the final salary offered for any position may be outside of this published range based on many factors, including but not limited to geography, education, experience, and/or certifications.<br><br>This list represents all of the currently listed positions as of November 1, 2022.<br><br>Position Title, Good Faith Salary Minimum, Good Faith Salary Maximum<br><br>Accounting title: Resident Engineer - 3824
description: <ul><li>Work with a fast-growing software company and a collaborative team|Work on greenfield projects and cutting edge new developments.<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is an industry leader in the youth sports and athletics industry, and this role is located in an northern Chicago suburb. Since this is an urgent hire, they have a fairly "quick" interviewing process to fill this position.<br><br><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write correct and clean code; consistently upholds &amp; exemplifies stated best practices.</li><li>Participate actively in the design of new technical features.</li><li>Learn quickly and make daily progress without the need for constant, significant feedback from more senior engineers.</li><li>Know when to ask for help in order to maximize work flow and if needed get unblocked.</li><li>Able to take ownership of small-to-medium features from technical design through completion.</li><li>Be capable of prioritizing tasks while avoiding getting caught up in insignificant details.</li><li>Ability to become self-sufficient in an area of the system with a high-level understanding of other components.</li><li>Capable of providing support for their system/platform area, including systems that they are not familiar with.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree or above in Computer Science or related field</li><li>At least 10+ years of experience as a Software Developer / Engineer</li><li>Strong experience with C#/ .NET - At least 7+ Years </li><li>Development experience Spring framework, Angular, React.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Top of the market salary, ranging from $155k-$190k based upon experience</li><li>Excellent total comp package with benefits</li><li>401k match, and Health care / Medical Insurances</li><li>Very generous PTO, sick, mental and holiday time-off<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong>Please feel free to email your updated resume and a summary of your relevant experience to JordanKurth @ MichaelPage.US.com<br><br><strong>Contact: Jordan Kurth<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-072023-6114621</strong>
